It is a bit warm when you enter from the humidity, but give it a few minutes. It'll cool down. It's not as cold as many other places when you walk in. You'll get room temperature water when you are seated.

Matcha latte - If you get it cold, it'll be an additional $1. I got it hot and it was good! There's a bit of grainy matcha on the bottom though.

Avocado toast - they were very generous with their avocado! Highly recommend this dish. It was seasoned very well. Their tomato was a bit mushy for me but it's just a preference.

Espresso soda - it's a sparkly drink. It was citrusy and pretty good. Usually people call or espresso tonic but they have it under soda.

VERY friendly staff (the guy who helps you when you enter). Wow. I haven't had such friendly people in such a place before. Food was delicious. Not the cheapest but worth it. Located in a cool place. Nice interior. Would recommend

A gem of a brunch spot ‚Äî service that truly goes above and beyond!

Dropped by for brunch with a few friends last Saturday (31 May) and left thoroughly impressed‚Äînot just by the food, but by the heart behind the service.

One of my friends accidentally ordered oat milk on its own instead of a coffee with oat milk. Honest mistake.

He was prepared to make another order. However, we check with the staff if there is something that they can support.

Even though it was clearly my friend‚Äôs slip-up, the staff went out of his way to replace the drink without hesitation or fuss. It was such a thoughtful gesture, and honestly not something you see every day in busy caf√©s.

This staff was actually taking care of the cashier and ensuring the whole cafe operation is running well.

Food-wise, everything we had was good. I had this weekend special Halibut fish‚Äîfresh, flavorful, and well-portioned.

The overall cafe ambience was warm and welcoming, with just the right mix of cozy and vibrant. You can tell they care about both the details and the overall experience.

Great food, great vibes‚Äîand genuinely kind people behind the counter. Will definitely be back!

Came on a late Monday afternoon with my friend hehehe we got the avocado toast, hummus + pita bread and dirty matcha üçµ

The food was really good actl hehe they were super generous w the avocado on the toast and the sourdough wasn‚Äôt too hard like some other places. They gave so much hummus too lol i finished the bread alr but there was still q a bit of hummus left!! The matcha was good ‚Äî I‚Äôve never had dirty matcha before and this was my first time trying so I hv nothing to compare it to but it was yummy to me. I love the atmosphere too hehe I love how bright the cafe was and the vibes.

Will def be back!!! Iw to try the other items on the menu but on this day my friend was vegetarian so we cut back. Anyway I had a good time!!!‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è
Been here a few times and the service has been consistently good. I enjoyed the fries, coffee, granola fruits bowl and carbonara.

The price is quite high but it is worth it. The brunch menus are the best options for food here! The place is quite crowded at brunch to lunch time. Some of the tables are small. It is a very good place to sit and have a nice conversation with anyone while having a nice beverage.

It is a restaurant that serves breakfast ,brunch and all day dining that is very special and perfect.

About Food and Taste :
Although there is not a lot of variety to choose from, everything looks very special, showing the care that went into creating the menu.

I ordered toast because I came for breakfast. Every dish that was served was very special. The most impressive was the taste, the amount of food and the ingredients.
The coffee tastes great and the latte art is beautiful.

About Atmosphere :
The atmosphere of the shop is simple but modern, clean and well decorated.

About Service :
The service staff are very good, enthusiastic, ready to take orders and help.

We were pleasantly surprised by this place. Typical western breakfast and lunch served all day long. Delicious avo-bread, very good quality coffee, one of the best pain au chocolats we have ever tried!
Easy ordering system by QR code, food and drinks are served quickly and fresh.
Modern, bright and open interior, however the seats are not the most comfortable if you are staying for a longer time. Still, I'd come back anytime for a delicious treat (they even serve icecream!)

Had a fantastic meal here! The dishes were all incredibly plated and flavourful. The service was also good too. Service crew kinda assume every diner understood Chinese. Atmosphere was ok, better if it was a little quieter. Definitely recommend this spot for an authentic and delicious dining experience!"

There are many great food options in Singapore, both economically and on the expensive side but price doesn‚Äôt always translate to the food quality you get.  We decide to try Man Fu Yuan for dim sum and tried their sets.  Food was delicious and worth the one time experience.  Here‚Äôs my TA$TE ratings:

Taste:5 stars/delicious
Ambience: 5 stars/beautiful & clean
$: 4 stars/on the pricey side
Treatment: 5 stars/service was very good & attentive
Experience: 5 stars/overall experience was great.

Nice and cosy ambience, my favorite dish is the sweet and sour pork as it is abit crispy. We were served by Rene and Moon, very friendly and attentive. Rene even helped us to cut the birthday cake! Thumbs up for the excellent service üëç

Dining Experience @ Man Fu Yuan Restaurant.
.
Specialising in exquisite Chinese Cantonese fine dining, Man Fu Yuan Restaurant is lauded for being amongst the best Chinese fine dining restaurants in Singapore, acclaimed by the Michelin Guide, and renowned for beautifully presented dishes made with fresh quality ingredients that showcase an artful balance of flavours.
.
Ambience is elegant and intimate. The warmly lit, narrow dining hall accommodates just over 170 diners, making advance reservations a must. Furnishings are comfortable, and tableware is immaculate. Decor strikes a balance between contemporary minimalist and traditional Oriental aesthetics, creating a sophisticated yet welcoming ambience.
.
Service is attentive and efficient. Staff politely greet guests, showing them quickly to their seats, and demonstrating astute product knowledge with descriptions of the menu and its offerings. I note that staff proactively offer to clear finished plates throughout the meal, cleaning up quickly when diners leave. Advance reservations are also a breeze through the online platform.
.
Food is Chinese Cantonese cuisine. The kitchen is headed by Chef Aaron Tan, who serves up a dim sum ala-carte buffet on weekends and public holidays, priced at SGD $98++ per person. This gets you freshly prepared small tasting plates, unlimited in portion, made with quality ingredients and generally well executed. There's a range of over 40 dishes available, great value for money.
My husband and I had the privilege to have our private solemnization event + lunch at Man Fu Yuan Restaurant. ‚Ä¶

Came here for the $98/pax dimsum buffet and it was amazing. We took the first sitting which starts at 11.30am and they allowed us to go in at 11.25am so that we don‚Äôt ‚Äúlose out‚Äù on our eating time limit of 90 mins. Food was very good ‚Ä¶

We had the dim sum lunch buffet at Êª°Á¶èËãë to celebrate my wife's birthday. Wonderful service experiences provided by Shirley, Chin Chin, Xiao Ni & Chef Oh. Shirley & Chin Chin were very attentive to us and spot-on recommendations for the food. ‚Ä¶

One of our favourite restaurant. Please book your table in advance. Some of the days are crowded. The staffs and chef are very friendly and approachable. Food is great even though it‚Äôs on the high side. Highly recommending 3.33 roast meat, Irish duck and winter melon soup.
Very attentive service, the waitresses ensured our tea is always filled and changed plates etc whenever needed. ‚Ä¶

Just had the pleasure of experiencing the 4 Hands dinner at Man Fu Yuan, and wow - what a night! It was a special collaboration between Chef Aaron Tan of Man Fu Yuan and Chef Eng Tong from Alma, and every dish that came out was a ‚Ä¶

When hunger hit me at midnight, I found this restaurant on Google Maps, open until 2 AM. Upon arrival, I was pleasantly surprised to find a lively dance party hosted by a group of Mexican tourists. The food was delightful, and Upind Kumar provided excellent service.

best Indian Food in town

after COVID they changed from rooftop to waterfront (rooftop was great)

but the same variety and best quality in the menu

always coming back

The service and atmosphere was vibe. Our table was served by parveen who was such a sweet person. Highly recommend coming here if you want a good deal on drinking and excellent food this is the place to be!

After arriving in Singapore earlier today, we walked down to the riverfront in search of a restaurant for an early dinner. There were many restaurants along the water from which to choose. The Our Village Curry Hut appealed to us because the menu clearly listed both vegetarian and non-vegetarian dishes. We were seated at a table by the water's edge with great views of the Parliament and Supreme Court buildings across the river, passing sightseeing boats were fun to watch, and the Marina Bay Sands building could be seen in the distance. We ordered samosas, tikka chicken kabob, fried paneer, vegetable rice biryani, a mineral water bottle, and one beer. All of the food was delicious and was about $90 SGD. The staff was friendly and attentive and packed up our leftovers well. We definitely recommend trying this restaurant.

Our Village is a charming and beautifully designed restaurant located at Boat Quay. The ambience is warm and inviting, with courteous staff ( specific name is Rahim), adding to the pleasant experience. While the service takes a reasonable amount of time, it allows you to relax and enjoy the riverside setting. Overall, it's a delightful place to unwind and savour a good meal by the river.

Great food and location! The only weird thing is that the dishes don‚Äôt automatically come with rice. So you would basically pay 21 SNG dollars just for the Palak Paneer, for example. But still, no reason not to eat there!
Best indian food in boat quay
Really nice food on the river. Best Indian food had for a while. Good service too.
Amazing food and a great place to hangout with friends! Everyone was very warm and friendly :)
super friendly and helpful staff, great hangout spot with friends and cheap drinks
Great food and nice service. Would love to come back again. Trully good value for money.

Love the Indian food served here at the heart of the CBD.

The dishes are tasty and the portions are reasonable. ‚Ä¶
I personally loved the vegetarian dishes: Crispy Vegetables, Mushroom Pepper Salt, Paneer Tikka, and the Paper Dosa. ‚Ä¶
Amazing indian food in the center of singapore. Best place for hangout, office lunch and family dining. Their dosa is so crispy and paneer tikka is so mouth watering.

We ordered special thali. The quantity of rice is enough for two people. The thali comes with two chapatis and a sweet.
The service is a bit laid back and can improve
The place is very clean and 100% recommended

The food is tasty... good portions, flavourful and to my liking. The service is decent but could be more attentive at times. The place looks nice and attractive. All in all, a good dining experience for indian food
Good restaurant to hop when you are visiting clarqe or merlion. The nearest indian restaurant from merlion

Trust my review, this is one of the best restaurant to have lunch!! Such a tasty and delicious food served over here which tasted exactly like tamilnadu.. price is bit high around 1.5k per meals! But for the quantity quality and taste we can compromise the price!! Their hospitality is really good!

Anjana Kitchen truly exceeded my expectations! The food was absolutely superb, with each dish bursting with flavor and freshness. The service was also top-notch - friendly, attentive, and knowledgeable about the Menu.
Company lunch so value is not a problem ü§£ Great garlic naan, butter chicken, gobi manchurian. Chicken briyani was a little dry ‚Ä¶

Came with family for lunch as it was conveniently located within Orchard. The food and service is excellent and I would definitely be back again! We got the octopus, steak, linguine and mushroom soup and the fusion taste is unique, playful and a wonderful surprise! Kelvin and his team has exceptional service and were attentive to any needs we had with pleasant smiles and friendly attitudes. Thank you so much for making our lunch special!

Excellent restaurant, very well located in the Orchard area. The service is outstanding, and there are great options for dinner. 2 beer options in the day I went (Heineken and Tiger). The atmosphere is lovely, with the option to sit outdoor. I eat the salmon and it was really nice. Recommended.

It was an upcoming public holiday and I decided to have a lunch outing with a group of friends. While searching for a new place to eat, I came across Eden Restaurant. My friends and I like the food there. Some items are a bit of fusion type. The ambience and atmosphere are relaxing. They have a bar service where it is filled with quite a selection of wines, alcohol and cocktails to savor. Food is delicious! The staff are attentive and friendly. Kudos to Kelvin and his team for great service. What is interesting is the walkway to the restroom; it looks like an entry way to a karaoke place (look at the photos). I will definitely revisit.

We had a delightful lunch at Eden, made even better by the warm and attentive service from Siva and the team. Every dish was beautifully presented and full of flavour‚Äîtruly fantastic fusion cuisine.

What stood out was the subtle Hainanese touch in the dishes we ordered, which added a nostalgic and homely twist to the modern plating. It‚Äôs not often you find a place that marries tradition and innovation this well.

Highly recommend for those looking for something refreshingly different, yet comfortingly familiar. We‚Äôll be back!
Yummy food and great ambience. I had the sg60 lunch set and it was amazing. Our waiter, Kelvin is very attentive and prompt with his service. Will come back

Went to Eden to celebrate my husband's birthday. The food we ordered were delicious. I really enjoyed their starters.

We ordered the burrata, scallop ceviche and lobster bisque, which were all delicious. My husband enjoyed the wagyu steak more than the black cod fish.

I made the reservation and noted that it was my husband's birthday. The restaurant was really nice to surprise my husband with a slice of cake.

Despite the crowd, the service staffs were very attentive to us and made sure we were attended to. One of the staff, Kelvin, even offered to help us with a photo.

Would recommend visiting for a nice dinner date or to celebrate an occasion.

Have been frequenting Eden every time I‚Äôm in town due to the Accor membership. The 50% off weekday a la carte meals make it very worthy for its generous portions. The food is fusion styled but nicely prepared. I love the crispy squid, cod fish, salmon & laksa. Do remember to ask for a complimentary parking coupon when you dine here!

With the food, establishment, service, etc. we have to acknowledge the price point is on the high side, but the restaurant lived up to its standards. It was not crowded, cosy in fact, and the food were good. Staff were also friendly. Cocktails were decent. The fusion between traditional and modern cuisine was done nicely.

We ordered the pork tenderloin and grilled octopus, and were pleasantly surprised by their flavor and texture. Both dishes were so enjoyable that we were already thinking about what to try on our next visit. Thanks for making our anniversary a memorable one.

Organised a farewell party for a friend a few weeks ago for 16 pax. Kelvin, the manager was very helpful from the start. He allocated an exclusive space for us at the corner of the restaurant to ensure that we have full privacy for the occasion and accommodated to other requests (e.g., pre ordering of some food) to make the experience seamless. The service rendered by Kelvin and his team (Luke & Johari) was top notched and worth a mention.

Food was great. The variety of food make it a good choice for large gathering as we a were able to try most of the items on the menu. Ambience was dim and cozy, making it a perfect venue for an elevated celebration.

I had the best time at Pullman today with a friend! From start to finish, the service was top-notch. Kelvin, the supervisor, made us feel right at home, walking us through the menu and offering great recommendations. He really made us feel welcome! The bartender, Luke, absolutely nailed it with his drink suggestions, each one was perfectly crafted and complemented with our food. Chef Yi Hung was so kind to help us split our dishes into two portions, even though the restaurant was buzzing. It really meant a lot! To top it off, knowing it was my birthday, they surprised me with a birthday cake which was such a thoughtful touch. It‚Äôs not often a restaurant goes above and beyond like that, but they totally did. Not to forget that one of the front office came up to find the supervisor to return my ID card as i dropped it at the lobby! All in all, a perfect meal and an unforgettable experience, will come visit again:)

Breakfast for the second day, Monday, August 18th, wasn't as busy as the previous day.

We went down from our room on the 9th floor to the 4th floor for breakfast.

Today's menu was different from the previous day.

The service staff, Kelvin, who escorted us to our table and greeted our children, was very friendly.

The breakfast food was also delicious.

Very good work.

Was served by Kelvin Restaurant Manager and Aaron HeadChef at Eden Restaurant on our 33rd Wedding Anniversary. Was delighted to receive complimentary champagne and anniversary cake on top of our sumptuous meal. Ambience of place was good for a quiet evening amidst the crowd. Servers were attentive and very obliging with our requests. Looking forward to eat with friends at this restaurant soon.

This was my third time at Eden, and it‚Äôs always a great experience. I always recommend it to friends because the place is nice and the food is really special.

This time we were celebrating a birthday lunch, and Kelvin Low took great care of us and made it very memorable. Big thanks to Johari too, for being so helpful with my Accor Plus membership.

Everything was worth it. Highly recommended!

Two weeks ago, I celebrated my birthday at Eden with my parents, and it turned out to be one of the most memorable dinners we‚Äôve had in a long time. The food was genuinely amazing. We ordered the beef wagyu, crispy squid, chilli crab buns, satay, two cocktails, and a drink ‚Äî everything was full of flavour and beautifully presented.

What truly made the night special was the service. Kelvin, the supervisor, went above and beyond to make us feel welcome. He was friendly, thoughtful, and offered great food recommendations. The moment that really stood out was when he surprised us with a birthday cake and tea for my family ‚Äî such a kind and unexpected gesture that made the evening feel personal and meaningful. The drinks were fantastic too ‚Äî big thanks to Luke, the bartender, for crafting cocktails that perfectly complemented the meal.

Between the delicious food, warm service, and genuine hospitality from both Kelvin and Luke, Eden made my birthday celebration feel truly special. We‚Äôll definitely be back ‚Äî and we‚Äôll be looking out for them again. Highly recommend!

Had a wonderful dining experience at Eden Restaurant, located within Pullman Hotel Orchard. The ambience was gorgeous ‚Äî designed like a greenhouse, it‚Äôs the perfect spot to chill and catch up with loved ones.

Special shoutout to their restaurant supervisor, Kelvin Johari, who went above and beyond to make our visit memorable. He noticed us fumbling with a self-timer camera and kindly offered to help take some shots for us. The photos turned out so good, it honestly felt like we were doing a pre-wedding shoot! üòÇ Super attentive and thoughtful service like this really makes a difference.

The food was equally impressive. I absolutely loved the Hainanese Mac & Cheese ‚Äî such a unique local twist done right. The Wagyu sirloin was another highlight, incredibly juicy and flavourful.

One small area for improvement would be the air-conditioning. While the greenhouse design is beautiful, we could barely feel any cooling ‚Äî ended up perspiring throughout the meal. Hopefully this can be improved for a more comfortable dining experience.

Still, would definitely return again for the great food and amazing service!

The best Dinner in Singapore.
Kumar gave us a wonderful experience, his recommendation was on point, wine recommendation was great, too.

Definitely I will come back with my family.

Beautiful glass garden under the stars. Wonderful personal touch from Catherine. Great recommendations and we had a sumptuous meal finishing off with a little bday celebration. Delicious lamb steak, grilled octopus, beef steak - all with a fusion twist and not missing the original flavor. Love it. :) Thank you Chefs!

Dining at Eden restaurant was an exceptional experience from start to finish. The atmosphere was warm and welcoming, the service was attentive without being intrusive, and the food‚Äîabsolutely phenomenal.

Special shout-out to Chef Louis‚Äîeach dish was crafted with precision, creativity, and a clear love for the culinary arts. For my main course, I had the salmon and cod fish, both of which were executed to perfection. (Pardon the photo of the cod fish‚Äîit was a sharing dish, and we couldn‚Äôt decide which to get.) The flavors were bold yet balanced, the ingredients fresh, and the presentation elegant. You can truly taste the passion Chef Louis brings to the kitchen.

Whether you‚Äôre a seasoned foodie or just love a great meal, this restaurant is a must-visit. Chef Louis has created something truly special, and I can‚Äôt wait to return for another unforgettable meal.

Top-notch welcome and service by Johari and Eugene. We thoroughly enjoyed all the creative dishes - every one had nusantara influences. from the Barramundi percik with French fries in kecap manis sauce, to the chargrilled  Lamb rack, and citrus linguine. And the laksa features huge tiger prawns and mussels.

Overall great experience w good vibes. Outdoor seating can be a little warm and humid even with fans, thankfully it poured halfway through our dinner.

Service was impeccable. Food was unique and delicious. Was expecting more from the pizza üçï given the reviews I read, however the pizza flavour we went with, had a strong unique spice taste that did not appeal to our palettes!

Otherwise great stuff! Will be back to try other dishes!

After much searching online for a nice place to bring the missus for her forever 21st birthday, I decided to patronise Osteria Mozza as I was attracted to their hand made pasta, and also I was hoping to finally find a place which serve great simple Italian food.
The service from the beginning till the end was good. I didnt get the names of the waiter and waitress who served us, but both were warm and friendly. This made our meal there very comfortable and definitely felt at home.
I particularly love the open kitchen concept, where one can see the food being prepared on the spot. And the missus loves the eye candy in the open concept kitchen, Executive Chef Mr Peter Briks üòÇ but was too shy to allow me to ask for a photo taken together.
Ok back to the food. The food was amazing! The last time I had such good Italian food was in Italy itself. Wholesome, hearty and amazingly fresh.
It would be even better if there is a complimentary bread basket on the table along with good olive oil and balsamic vinaigrette. Main reason for it is simply because we love to clear our plates with a good home made bread, how can we let any bit of amazing sauce or bits of to-die-for-food get rinsed off in the kitchen sink!
The bill is on the higher side but it was all damn worth it.
At the end of the meal, our dessert was served with a birthday candle for the missus and a polaroid photo of us was taken, clipped on a handwritten birthday card and given to us for keepsake. Although they do this for all their guests celebrating birthdays there, it is nevertheless heartwarming. But if the birthday card can be addressed by name to the birthday girl or boy, imagine the special  feeling that would bring.
Please maintain the quality and standards of your service and of course your food.
We will definitely be back!

Awesome place, my third trip today. Unfortunately the olive oil dessert is no longer available.
The Grilled Chicken Diavola is fantastic, the Boston Bay Mussels have shrunk and Garganelli rag√∫ Bolognese is ok.

Love the service here though.

This restaurant was recommended by my friend, so we decided to visit for our wedding anniversary.

The atmosphere is lively yet not too noisy, making it suitable for business meetings, family gatherings, or even dining alone.

The staff are friendly, always smiling, and proactive in suggesting dishes. They attentively observe customers to understand their preferences.

While the pork was slightly salty and oily, the Prosciutto Pizza dough had the perfect balance of chewiness and crispiness, and the combination of cheese and ham was flawless.

I plan to revisit the restaurant and try more pizzas and pasta for an even better dining experience.

I had a great experience celebrating my birthday there. The food was great, service was excellent. The Burrata was memorable! Meat Lover's Pizza and Orecchiette was flavourful.
The restaurant went the extra mile and took a polaroid for us, attaching it to a handwritten birthday card. It really made our evening!

Had a great experience celebrating Mother‚Äôs Day at Osteria Mozza. Staff were attentive and food was great. Still the best pizza in town for me. The beef cheek was so tender and flavourful. Looking forward to come back again!

Came here for lunch to celebrate my wife's birthday, the pizza is definitely better than the pasta, and the sweets are absolutely amazing. The service team is also very friendly, attentive and made the effort to make us feel special. 5 stars for the team.

Celebrated a birthday dinner here and everything from start to finish, including the cocktails, was amazing. Shout out to the service staff too for being attentive and friendly. Will be back again for sure.

My go-to spot for pasta and pizza. The fresh pasta has a great texture! I usually prefer olive oil-based pastas but their cream-based pastas are light and not overly rich. The pizzas have a crisp crust, and the ambiance is relaxed. Service is friendly and attentive. A good spot for quality Italian food.

Had a really great dinner date tonight. The service was impeccable. Raaj was really attentive and gave many great recommendation for food choice. Will definitely be back. The rosemary olive cake was a pleasant surprise. Will definitely be back

Was seated near the open kitchen and every single dish that poured out of the kitchen was a feast for the eyes. Then came the good. They tasted as good as they looked. The Crochette Di Carne was lightly fried till crispy and the wagyu beef blended very well with the garlic aioli. The Hokkaido grilled scallop was flawless - tender, soaked in butter and chilli oil which gave them the extra heat while the lime added some tanginess. The Spanish octopus were beautifully chargrilled to tender with a smoky flavour. The grilled king prawns were juicy and firm, swimming in a sea of garlic butter that complemented them perfectly.

Had an awesome birthday dinner at Bottega di Carna! The food was delicious ‚Äî especially the steak and the service was warm and thoughtful.
The ambience was perfect ‚Äî stylish yet cozy, with a lively vibe that made the night feel special. They even surprised me with a birthday dessert! Thank you for such a memorable evening. Highly recommended;)

Fritto misto of whitebait, squid and shrimp was light and crispy, oil used was fresh, like well made tempura. The seafood bisque of the al dente casarecce came was rich and crustaceany (?), sopped it up with leftover focaccia.  The olive oil was slightly bitter and spicy, good stuff.

Airy, well lit, quiet atmosphere.  Will come back.

Stayed at Mondrian Duxton, hence the necessity to try out Bottega di Carna. Great atmosphere and ambience. Service is good and food is served swiftly. Ordered Vongole and am not disappointed. Pasta was al dente and flavourful. Love the scallops and calamari too. Would definitely return.

An amazing dining experience from start to finish! The food was delicious, with every dish full of flavor and beautifully presented.

The service was exceptional ‚Äì warm, attentive, and highly knowledgeable, particularly thanks to General Manager Martin and his excellent team. His food recommendations were spot on, perfectly aligning with our taste preferences and needs.

Highly recommend this place for anyone looking for great food and top-tier service.

We will come back. Bravo

What happens when a talented Italian chef got his heart broken?

He opens a modern restaurant in Singapore called ‚ÄòBottega di Carna‚Äô. With a gigantic revolving stand of flowers and orchids dedicated to his former lover which the FedEx probably forget to delivery on time. With a neon of love poem displayed beside the bar, one that is too heartfelt not to be relatable.

Anyways, the food here is rather fantastic! Joining the gang of gastronomic restaurants in Duxton Hill with the same feverish passion.

I was told to try the steak because it‚Äôs ‚ÄôA steak house‚Äô but honestly the steaks are just above average and personally it isn‚Äôt one of the top rankings group in Singapore. BUT their speciality is truly in things related to sauces.

ü¶™ Hokkaido Scallop
Large soft scallops resting on so much fresh rocks of raw salts that can maybe, it can somewhat revive the death scallops. The sauce here is lightly spice but some sort buttery taste. It‚Äôs seriously good!

ü•© Ribeye
Soft texture but don‚Äôt expect much from a ‚ÄòGrain fed‚Äô cow. If you‚Äôre gonna get a sauce, Lo & Behold‚Äî The peppercorn isn‚Äôt your average pepper sauce! If they were to cook black pepper crab with it, JUMBO Seafood will lose at least half its customers!

üç∞ Tiramisu
Super soft & wet cake (From heart broken chefs?) with lots of cream but the last layer at the bottom contains so much Kahlua or whatever secret booze, that you‚Äôre very much likely to forget who your lover is/was for 24 hours‚Äî It‚Äôs the Italian style.

A lush greenery vibes with modern twist. Love the thoughtful seats with spine-level cushion. Chair and table was of perfect height combination for Asian descent. Attentive staff hustling all over. Great recipes‚Äî I would certainly invest my dollar in the sauce based dish.

Thanks Hari (Don‚Äôt burn more of your hair from performing that flamboyant flaming dessert) & crew! üå∏ü§µüèªüë®üèª‚Äçüç≥üëçüèª

Service was great! Awesome food.. lobster pasta, grain fed rib eye and limone dessert is a must order. Lobster is fresh and portion is good. Steak is nicely char, even without any sauce it is still very good.

Food was delicious, service was attentive and friendly, nice decor, seats were very comfortable. We had the artichoke tarts, beef croquettes to start which were tasty small bites. We then had the gnocchi, the smoked cheese was perfect. The chicken was well cooked and the asparagus had a lovely charred flavour. Would recommend and go back again.
A fantastic Italian restaurant tucked away in a cool part of town. The food was all delicious and presented nicely. Highly recommend the lobster fettuccine  and the ribeye steak.

Today i visited here with my freinds. All the staffs are very kind and the manager recommended a wine to us and it was so good. We were very pleased to feel the comfortable vibe, nice manner and yummy dishes in this restaurant. I would visit here next time. Thank you for nice service!

We had such a wonderful dining experience at Bottega di Carna. Everything, from the food to the service, was exceptional. We enjoyed two perfectly cooked steaks, a great glass of wine, the creamiest mushroom soup (truly one of the best I‚Äôve had), and a delicious plate of pasta. Every dish was flavorful and clearly prepared with care.

What really stood out, though, was the service. The team was incredibly attentive and thoughtful throughout our meal. A small but memorable gesture was when they split our pasta into two plates because my husband and I were sharing ‚Äì and they did this before we even asked! It‚Äôs little touches like that which make such a difference. The staff really made us feel looked after, and their attention to detail was impressive.

If there‚Äôs one thing to relook into, it might be the furniture. The chairs, while beautiful, were a bit uncomfortable ‚Äì the height with the table felt awkward, and the lack of proper support meant that many guests (including us) seemed to be sitting in strange postures.

Overall, we left so impressed with the food, the service, and the overall atmosphere. If you‚Äôre looking for a great meal paired with thoughtful service, Bottega di Carna is definitely worth a visit.

Went here for my Graduation dinner. Definitely an amazing experience! The food was wonderful and the staff was warm and welcoming. Being seated next to the kitchen, there was clear camaraderie between the staff which contributed to the excellent service.

A steak lovers paradise!  Excellent tomahawk steak rich in Flavour. Steak tartare paired well with the deep fried beef tendons. Dishes like the gnocchi & eggplant parmigiana had rich cheesy flavors, maybe strong for those who like mild cheese. Great service from all the crew. Very nice of them to provide 2 free desserts for those of us celebrating our birthdays. A place I would go again in search of great steaks
I hardly rate five star for all services. This is one place I do that. It gets all five star. Love the dessert love the steak n the Service is good. recommended for birthdays
Had a solo lunch and enjoyed the lunch set. Price was reasonable. Service was average, though the manager tried to expedite checkout at the end. Overall, a pleasant lunch experience.

I had an incredible dining experience at Bottega Di Carna! The food was absolutely delicious and beautifully presented, bursting with flavors that made every bite memorable. The service was exceptional‚Äîattentive, friendly, and welcoming. The hospitality truly stood out, making us feel right at home. The atmosphere was warm and inviting, with a perfect blend of comfort and style.

A special thank you to the team at Bottega Di Carna for surprising me with a birthday cake‚Äîit was such a thoughtful gesture that made my celebration even more memorable. I truly appreciated the effort and kindness. Highly recommend this gem for anyone looking for a top-notch dining experience!

Such a beautiful restaurant in a modern sheek hotel. The vibe and atmosphere, created a beautiful surreal environment.  Felt so comfortable and cosy.

The staff were so friendly and very professional at their jobs!

I love the open kitchen where you can watch how everything works and Feel the pulse of the engine of the restaurant.

Dishes were beautifully plated, and they had really good flavours.

Will come back to try the pastas next time!

Had an early birthday celebration on 8/2. The service and food were impeccable! The Indian gentleman who served my wife and I was outstanding! His recommendations were spot on. The food was great. Worth a visit!

A Stunning Dining Experience at Bottega di Carna

During my stay at the Mondrian Duxton, I had the pleasure of dining at Bottega di Carna for both dinner and breakfast. Both experiences were thoroughly enjoyable!

The restaurant‚Äôs ambiance is simply breathtaking. With natural light flooding in during the day and an artistic, cozy vibe in the evening, it‚Äôs a perfect spot for any meal. The whimsical rotating Christmas tree and thoughtfully curated art pieces add a unique charm, while the lush garden area outside offers a serene escape in the middle of the city.

I highly recommend trying the Lobster Parpadelle‚Äîa standout dish during my dinner. The flavors were rich and satisfying, making it a must-have. Breakfast was equally delightful, with a great variety to start the day on the right note.

Bottega di Carna combines gorgeous surroundings with delicious food, making it a great spot for hotel guests and visitors alike. Definitely worth a visit!

Love the look and feel of this place! Had buffet breakfast here as part of the hotel stay - decent spread and generally good quality of food.

Friendly and warm service too. Very prompt clearing of used plates without being intrusive.

Greeted by a warm friendly team, Hari then introduced us their signature dishes.
For starters, I‚Äôm a cheese lover, hence ordered Buratta, for main dish, meat lovers must order medium rare steak. Veggie lovers, go with broccolini sides. Dessert lovers, order Tiramisu.
Had a great dining experience there.

Bottega di Carna shines in all the ways that truly matter. The food, service, and ambiance came together seamlessly, creating an unforgettable lunch.

The meal began with a welcoming touch: The bread was wonderfully soft on the inside, and the olive oil was rich and fragrant.

The Burrata salad was a highlight, offering a perfect harmony of flavors. The creamy, fresh cheese paired beautifully with the vibrant salad ingredients, showcasing a masterful balance of simplicity and sophistication. It‚Äôs a dish that not only delighted the palate but also demonstrated the restaurant‚Äôs commitment to quality ingredients.

The 150-day grain-fed Black Angus Ribeye was another standout. Cooked flawlessly to medium rare, the steak was tender, juicy, and packed with flavor. Each bite reflected the exceptional quality of the meat and the skill of the kitchen. It‚Äôs a must-try for any steak enthusiast and a testament to the restaurant‚Äôs expertise in delivering elevated dishes.

The seabass, while well-cooked and fresh, didn‚Äôt quite match the wow factor of the other dishes. It lacked the boldness or creativity that made the rest of the meal shine. It felt more understated, which may appeal to some, but it wasn‚Äôt as memorable compared to the rest of the offerings.

Overall, Bottega di Carna left a lasting impression with its outstanding food, thoughtful service. From the complimentary bread and olive oil to the main dishes, every detail reflected the restaurant‚Äôs dedication to providing an exceptional dining experience. Despite minor critiques, we left feeling thoroughly impressed.

One of my all-time favorite Italian restaurants for steak! The atmosphere is fantastic, and the food never disappoints. Super lucky to meet the legend himself‚Äîthe world‚Äôs greatest butcher! His signature steak tartare is a must order. The Florentina T-bone was perfectly cooked and deeply satisfying. Other Italian dishes we had were also top quality. Can‚Äôt wait to return!

Came here for my birthday and had a great time. They have many different cuts of steak, and also gave me a free dessert since it was my bd :)

For my personal preference, I think it's nice to try but maybe won't come back because I'm more of a value for money kind of diner and it felt a bit in the pricey side. You're paying for the great service, nice atmosphere, convenient location, etc. Nonetheless, had a great time!

Awesome starters, mains and desserts. We ordered the Porterhouse, sea bass and chicken. All were executed and presented beautifully. Excellent service by Maran who was prompt in clearing our plates and was always checking in on us. Attentive yet unobtrusive service. Will be back again to try the breakfast!

I had the pleasure of celebrating my birthday dinner at Bottega di Carna at the Mondrian Singapore, and it was a fantastic experience from start to finish. It was my first time dining there, and I was impressed. The ambience was lovely‚Äîperfect for a special occasion‚Äîand the attentive service made us feel truly welcome. The servers were knowledgeable and made excellent recommendations, which were spot on. Every dish we tried was superb, but the scallops, steaks, and fish were absolute standouts. I‚Äôll definitely be back!

All the dishes we ordered were fantastic. The chicken was surprisingly tender.

However, there were some miscommunications when reserving; was not told the accor plus discount was capped at 6 pax when i made a booking for 7 pax, but the discount was honored in the end.

We had an amazing dinner!
The steak was perfectly cooked, the fish was delightful, and the broccolini quickly became my favorite. The burrata was also exceptional. Everything was simply amazing!

Our host, Mint, provided outstanding service and made our dining experience even more enjoyable. We absolutely love the place and its ambiance. We will definitely be coming back!

Highly recommend!

The handmade pasta was rich, flavorful, and perfectly al dente, while the chicken breast surprised us with its tenderness and depth of flavor. Elevated comfort food at its best.

Dessert was equally impressive, refined, well-balanced, and the perfect sweet finish. What truly stood out was the service. Staff were warm, attentive, and polished. They changed our cutlery promptly between courses and made sure we felt well taken care of throughout the meal.

A vibrant space, exceptional food, and service that goes the extra mile. Bottega di Carna is a standout in Singapore‚Äôs dining scene.

I recently dined at Bottega Di Carna, located within the Mondrian Hotel at Duxton, and it was an unforgettable culinary experience. This restaurant is a must-visit, especially if you are a steak enthusiast.

The highlight of our meal was undoubtedly the tomahawk steak. Cooked to perfection and finished tableside, it was a true spectacle and tasted absolutely divine. The steak was tender, juicy, and packed with flavor. You can also choose from a variety of sauces to complement the steak, enhancing the already exquisite taste.

In addition to the amazing steak, Bottega Di Carna boasts a commendable wine selection.

The service was top-notch, with friendly and attentive staff ensuring that we had everything we needed throughout our meal. The food quality was exceptional, and every dish was prepared with great attention to detail.

If you are looking for a fantastic dining experience with outstanding steak, Bottega Di Carna at the Mondrian Hotel is the place to go. Highly recommended!

Celebrated our wedding anniversary over lunch at this cozy restaurant. The service was excellent and all the dishes we ordered were well executed. The restaurant is also very thoughtful to give us a complimentary Chocolate Fondant for our celebration. Will definitely come back again.

Hari was delightful ‚Äî service top notch from start till end. He even showed us around the place and explained to us more about the aged meats. His recommendations were also stellar and helped us to order the right amount for an enjoyable experience.

Food wise, we loved the Cauliflower ‚Äî slightly sweet and spicy, paired really well together with the Pork dish which was more on the savoury side. Cook of the pork was excellent, with a slight pink in the middle. However, beans weren‚Äôt our favourite, seems like it doesn‚Äôt go that well together but that‚Äôs could just be our preference.

Pici was flavourful and a good recommendation by Hari as well. Artichoke tart was interesting albeit goat cheese is still the forefront flavour profile, so if not a cheese fan might not recommend.

They even gave a complimentary Tiramisu for birthday celebration, super thoughtful.

Overall, ambience was great, service was splendid and food was incredible. Will definitely be back to try more dishes! Thank you Hari!

I love this restaurant, have been multiple times in the past few months.

Their Pici pasta is a must try! Wonderful ambience and service are a plus

I enjoyed the meal here, everything was well prepared, just not super exceptional. The one thing that stood out was the eggplant parmigiana - best I've ever had. One quirk though: when we asked for help with the wine it didn't feel the server knew his stuff. The wine was ok but not as described.

My friend and I sat in a corner one Friday evening and had an absolutely stellar dining experience at Bottega di Carna tonight. The food was beautifully executed, full of flavour and creativity, and the overall vibe of the restaurant was lively yet intimate ‚Äì perfect for a relaxed catch-up dinner.

What truly made the evening exceptional, however, was the service from Martin. His initiative, genuine attentiveness, and warm professionalism stood out from the moment we were seated. He anticipated our needs before we even asked, offered thoughtful recommendations, and checked in on us just the right amount without ever interrupting the flow of conversation. He came over to chat with us too, and made us feel so welcome and well taken care of ‚Äì it elevated the dinner from great to unforgettable.

Thank you to Martin and the team for such a wonderful evening. I will definitely be back soon. I had hoped to thank him personally at the end of the evening but couldn't get him at the end, nor could his colleague. So I hope this message gets to him in the end!

Came here to celebrate anniversary as part of a colleagues recommendation and wasn‚Äôt disappointed. Food and presentation were excellent and the waiter that served us was pleasant and surprised us to tiramisu for our anniversary! Highly recommended to come here

Apr 25

Dinner 4 of us

Trying this new italian restaurant at the Mondrian hotel

Ambience quite casual and relax.

Service prompt and attentive also give good recommendations of the menu

FnB:
- porterhouse very tender and juicy
- fish tasty and nicely cooked
- calamari nice
- fried eggplant very yummy 9/10
- pici pasta also nice n yummy

Everything is good and nice. Only the price I think a bit on the high side.

The restaurant is started by the world's most famous butcher so we had to get carnivorous. The steak tartare was minced so tender tho not mindblowing. On the other hand, the soy-marinated lamb cutlets with cucumber yogurt was smokey, juicy and rightly balanced between the lean and fattiness

But the highlight and most unique was the green lagsana. I took a bite and immediately thought truffle, but it was just THAT packed with mushroom, and the stuffing complete with kale and taleggio cheese.

Great experience here really can‚Äôt complain at all cept the chairs could be more comfortable !

Friend has the set lunch (1) beef cheeks ? Really soft and good flavour (2) Christmas dessert believe it was a mousse

Steak Tartare was good although a little small. During look like a normal tartare but don‚Äôt be tricked it had great flavour and perfect with the pork skin I think it was used to vehicle food into your mouth !

Also had the Pici which was perfectly al dente + good meat flavour + pinch of spice !

Honestly didn‚Äôt come in expecting much but we had a great meal and it‚Äôs a small gesture but appreciate the birthday wish !

went on a sunday evening with a gf one mine- v intimate setting and great service. food was delicious as well. I‚Äôd reccomend the pumpkin tortelli and lamb chops. Warm and fluffy bread and butter (complimentary) was great as well.

pictures are in half-sized portions bc we asked the lovelystaff to split it for us (only bc there werent many ppl dining atp of time)

Food and ambience were excellent. Steaks were delicious and nicely paired with creamed spinach and this tasty orange colored puree (no idea what it is). Also highly recommend the fish, an excellent dish (which is rather surprising since they‚Äôre a steakhouse). Staff was attentive but not overbearing. And the tiramisu - best I‚Äôve tasted in a long while. Don‚Äôt miss it.

Mi piace questo ristorante. From its very cosy and elegant design, to the warm service and fabulous food, this restaurant is worthy for all the 5 stars reviews it deserved. Just a special shout out to the restaurant manager for offering us a free dessert after a mix up with the staff. We asked if the restaurant is still serving the pasta that is prepared with the cheese wheel, and the staff said no. However, this was not true as we saw it being served to other tables later. This was when the manager came to apologise to us saying that it is only served when he is there. He offered to prepare one for us but we were already full by then. It is a pity though, but the rest of the food is equally amazing. Just remember to ask for the salt to go with any of the steaks, it truly elevates the flavour and makes the meat extra tasty.

Love the vibes, service and food here! I‚Äôll definitely recommend the green lasagna, super interesting and packed full of flavor.

Random side note but their furniture is also well thought-out! It‚Äôs super smart that their dining tables have a ledge built in to it for you to place your bag on.

Was here for the first time to celebrate a friend‚Äôs birthday. The atmosphere was a 10/10, perfect for gatherings, dates etc. Their cheese wheel pasta which isn‚Äôt on the menu was an absolutely show stealer, as it was the perfect amount of cheesiness and I just love the texture of the pasta. Even the ox tongue risotto was delicious as well. Compared to the mains, the starters pales a little in comparison (perhaps we didn‚Äôt order the right things) Highly recommended to all still!
Love the ambience of restaurant ‚Äì classy and relaxing. Gnocchi was amazing so as their signature tiramisu cake!

Had a lovely meal here. Steak was nice but more surprisingly the branzino fillet was incredible. Like, so good. Would come back again just for it or for the whole branzino. Calamari & creamed spinach was also great. Tartare was meh.

Service team was lovely, and the space is beautiful.

Went there with friend for the dinner.
Cozy environment, good service and foods.
I think I will go back again.

Recently, we had a birthday celebration at Bottega Di Carna. It's located at the lobby of Mondrian Singapore Duxton and take a lift up to level 3. The ambience was inviting and modern.

We were greeted with friendly and attentive Staff. They recommended us with their signatures.
For starters, we had their complementary bread,  ordered crispy Calamari and Artichoke tarts.
For mains, we had Pumpkin Ravioli, zucchini noodles and lamb chops.

Crispy calamari was good, overall food was decent.

Good place to have great meats. The restaurant is on the 3rd floor of Mondrian. Quite posh. The pasta starter was on the house which is quite nice of them. It‚Äôs pretty good. Eggplant dish was so yummy. The cheese and pastry was oven baked to a nice crunch. For the meat we went with the ribeye and pork loin. So good. Had a side of broccolini. Dessert tiramisu of course. All in all a pretty good meal.

Amazing stuff. Very attentive. Breakfast was outstanding and I can tell quality products have been used. Huge variety, including salmon sashimi. Fruits were extremely fresh and tasteful. Scrambled eggs were to die for. Pastries were amazing as well. Oh no breakfast was well worth it $30, when you buy it from the reception not on the spot.
Calamari is a must order dish! Great service, friendly crew and good recommendation on wine ! Casual dining as is situated in a hotel

We were there to celebrate a friend's birthday and we ordered dishes to share.

We were served with complimentary bread, to be enjoyed with their in-house olive oil.

I wanted a cocktail and asked for recommendations for something that's refreshing. For this bespoke experience, I got a drink called 'Southside' which is gin-based, with lemon juice and syrup.

The Artichoke Tart was aesthetically pleasing and fun to eat. Loved the first cheese and honey combo.

The fried calamari was flavourful with crisp golden brown batter.

The pumpkin ravioli was of a nice bright hue and inside, there's cacioricotta cheese.

My favourite dish, would be the stockyard ribeye. I think I can eat the whole plate on my own!

For dessert, the chocolate fondant was very likeable. On top of that, the staff brought out ice cream (complete with lighted candles) for the birthday girl.

All in all, I enjoyed the dining experience here as I can feel the thoughtfulness/attentiveness of the Chefs and the staff towards their guests.

Celebrated wife‚Äôs birthday. Food was great and didnt had to wait for long. Open concept kitchen was also entertaining!

Had a hearty lunch hence couldnt afford to try the steak, Pork Loin was real tender. Wife is 34 weeks pregnant, went for the online recommended lasagna instead; interesting taste.

Even received a complimentary cake (no tiramisu since it contains alcohol). Kudos to team for service!

There was a party the Friday night we dined in so it was a little noisy. Food was good, particularly the steak, I still recall how tender and flavorful it was. The staff were attentive, the service was pleasant, and the warm lights provide a soothing ambience. I didn't like the desserts, found all too sweet (I do not have a sweet tooth.) I'll go back again!

As a italian food lover, this place serve authentic Italian food. Artichoke tart and Beef tartare was amazing, i had the risotto and my wife had chicken breast! Service is very good. I would recommend to dine here with friends & family!

My bff brought me here to celebrate his job confirmation, and this place definitely served the occasion!

The burrata with tomatoes were such a treat that we asked for 2 extra servings of focaccia bread (which were amazingly soft and suitable for wiping clean the burrata dish).

The lamb rack surprised us. While most lamb racks disappoint due to this protein‚Äôs difficult nature, Bottega di Carna nailed it. It was wonderful and we would return just for that over our usual preference of steak (which we had, but it wasn‚Äôt that memorable).

We ended off with tiramisu (of course), and we wished the serving for two could be more than that.

I had a glass of red recommended by the waiter, a Richard Hamilton Colton‚Äôs GSM. It was a delight!

needed to visit the world's greatest butcher's restaurant and had a memorable dining experience with perfectly cooked steak and flavourful pasta. also, zucchini appetiser was a delight. a wee bit disappointed that all aperitivos were unavailable but we ordered a refreshing cocktail instead. friendly and accommodating staff, too.
Having an unforgettable moment at Bottega di Carna! The chef and staff are doing a great job of keeping up the quality of the dishes and the standard of services.

Amazing experience at this place. The whole ambiance and the service was impeccable.

Must order:

Grilled Scallop - very fresh and the doneness was excellent

Green Lasagna - the texture from the layerings was an experience on its own

Whole Branzino - well-balanced

Creamed Spinach - great complement to the meal

Awesome service provided by the team. I believe it was the manager who was wearing a suite. He gave us what he thought was good.  Mr Steven was also amazing making small talks and making the experience enjoyable. The guy in red today was also awesome. Will be back again. Thank you.

Idk about you but I find it hard to find a steakhouse with a large variety of dishes that can cater to various diets. I was pleasantly surprised at the variety of veggie dishes at this restaurant, all of which were AMAZING. I am not really a health foodie so I‚Äôve always been skeptical about zucchini noodles but wow it was a refreshing and palate-cleansing starter! The spice level of the Cauli with harissa also really hit the spot. Of course the steak was really good but I think the other dishes stole the show for me üòÖ the caviar spaghetti was also surprising with citrus zest offsetting the heavy creamy sauce. Looking forward to trying everything else on the menu!

Service wise, the staff were also impeccable. Felt like I was back in the US. Warm, friendly but not in your face hovering sort of table service. Was a really great experience all around!

We had an excellent dining experience here at Bottega di Carna. We were here for the first time to celebrate a birthday, and we found the food to be very good.

The stockyard 200-day grain fed bone-in strip loin that we ordered was grilled to a perfect medium rare and had that smokey char, with a good balance of fat to meat ratio - just enough to be juicy and tender but not too much. This was a favourite for sure.

The whole branzino (it‚Äôs a European sea bass) was also josper-grilled and deboned; with olive oil, garlic, capers, olives and lemon. A clean-tasting fish with crispy grilled skin.

The pumpkin ravioli, one of their vegetarian handmade pastas, was filled with feta cheese, and the pumpkin sauce was delicious.

The creamed spinach comes topped with a sunny side up egg. Arguably one of the best renditions of creamed spinach I‚Äôve tasted and definitely worth an order.

The chocolate fondant was delicious, and so too was the lemon givre (described as a lemon tart without the crust, and comes with Prosecco jelly under a bed of meringue in a lemon half-shell).

Service was excellent. The waitstaff were very attentive and kept coming around often to refill our water and make sure we were comfortable. Food is pricey for sure, but this restaurant is nonetheless very much worth a revisit for special occasions.

Had one of the best tomahawk in Singapore with impeccable service from Vin! Shoutout to the tiramisu, wowzaaaa!! Amazing!

Coming back for more!

One of the best steaks I've had in a while (I ordered the Angus ribeye). We also had the artichoke tarts, ravioli, and beef tartare - everything was great! Even the tiramisu, which came complimentary for a birthday celebration. Will definitely be back to try the lamb chops, and different cuts of steak!

Truly enjoyed our dining experience at Bottega Di Carna. Loved the table we were given facing all the live action of the kitchen, to see chefs at work. Food was amazing, loved everything we ordered from the Artichoke Tart & Steak Tartare for starters to a Stockyard Ribeye cooked to perfection with Creamed Spinach & Tuscan Beans, and of course a delicious classic Tiramisu to end, paired with a house-made Limoncello. It was our first time there, but it really felt like we‚Äôve already been there several times before - the level of hospitality by the entire team was truly incredible! Big shoutout to Chef Alastair, Martin, Burn, Gary who looked after us so well & Jea-ann who welcomed us very warmly. We will be back very soon indeed for more!

The food,service and atmosphere is really amazing. I am exceptionally impress by the service here. All the ppl there were super friendly and welcoming. Shout out to Mr Harry. He is super welcoming towards us today when we were dinning in. We had a wonderful experience because of him. He recommend really amazing food. My partner and I really enjoyed it so much. Besides that he made so much effort in ensuring that we are comfortable and everything is all right and well set. His service towards the customers is really out of what he should do. He took a step forward to make sure that his customers are comfortable and enjoying. Thank you Mr Harry for making such a wonderful night for us
All dishes we ordered were excellent, and so were the staff. Highly recommended and worth every cent üëçüèº

Bottega Di Carna stands out among celebrity restaurants, defying the usual underwhelming experiences that come with fame. Nestled within the Mondrian Singapore Duxton hotel, this contemporary Italian eatery is the outpost of the famed Tuscan butcher Dario Cecchini, hailed for his appearances on Netflix's Chef's Table and his impressive clientele including Elton John, Anthony Bourdain, and King Charles. Dubbed the "World's Greatest Butcher" by the New York Times, Cecchini infuses the restaurant with his mastery of butchery and bold creativity. The menu highlights flame-kissed meats alongside homemade pastas, charcuterie, fresh seafood, and a variety of classic and unconventional meat cuts.

Appetizers dazzle with options like zesty Seabass Crudo and perfectly crisped golden Calamari, while the savoury, cheesy Parmigiana delights the palate. Vegetarian offerings such as cold zucchini noodles with basil pesto and roasted cauliflower with spiced honey, almond, thyme, and garlic provide flavourful options for non-meat eaters. Pastas are authentic: the Pici Bolognese comes with a rich and hearty Bolognese sauce simmered to perfection with aromatic onions, garlic, and tomatoes, mingling with savory shredded beef braised for 8 hours till tender, finished with a touch of fresh herbs and a hint of red wine - kudos to Chef Kenny Huang who honed his craft in Turin for several years.

Seated at the open kitchen, diners can observe the culinary magic firsthand. The restaurant's vibrant, playful, and elegant interior, coupled with floor-to-ceiling windows overlooking the outdoor garden, creates a picturesque setting for a memorable birthday celebration, topped by attentive and professional service.

I was invited for a business lunch there a few weeks ago. I wasn‚Äôt very hungry so I chose the 2-course lunch set. I ordered the scallops for starter and the sirloin for main. The scallops in yuzu were delicious and innovative. The meat was well cooked and good. Would definitely like to go back and have a proper ribeye steak one day.

Awesome food awesome ambience and service !

Special thanks to Vin and Hari for the memorable and amazing service, the food was excellent!

Will recommend to give this restaurant a shot! ^^

Every dish was truly amazing. Came here on a Monday for dinner as many restaurants in Singapore are closed on Mondays. My favourite dishes were the creamed spinach, beef tartare, chocolate fondant. I liked how they put two teabags in the tea pot when I ordered the peppermint tea

The only things were that the waiters/waitresses kept asking us everything was okay VERY frequently üòÖ Perhaps it‚Äôs an SOP they have. And also the decaf coffee tasted strangely ‚Äúherbal‚Äù ü§î

I would like to recommend this place for anyone looking to try a new Italian restaurant in Singapore. My favourite part about this restaurant is how nice the interior design/furniture choice is! We ordered the steak tartare, beef carpaccio, pici pasta and chocolate fondant. Price was reasonable compared to other similar-category Italian restaurants. The wine menu was concise which is good. Prices start at $18 per glass/$90 per bottle for the Italian reds. Service staff were friendly and attentive but perhaps overly zealous as they were eager to clear my plate even while I was still eating. Nonetheless we will be back again to try the steak and tiramisu which we did not have the capacity for during this visit.
*Note that parking is $5/hour (so you can plan your visit better)
Everything was perfect. food, service and ambience. I like the grilled fish. Skin cooked crispy yet fish meat was very tender and juicy. I will definitely visit again.

We enjoyed an impromptu dinner at this lovely modern Italian restaurant! The meats were well executed, the Stockyard Ribeye was flavourful and the Branzino fillet was well seasoned. The appetisers and sides such as the broccolini, burrata, and zucchini noodles were refreshing and satisfying. Service by Shi Heng was good, prompt and friendly. Would recommend this restaurant for a romantic date! üòç P.S. damage done was about $250 for two pax.

My family and I recently visited to try their new set lunch menu, and it‚Äôs safe to say we were thoroughly impressed.

At $36++ per person (before applying our Accor Plus discount), the three-course set lunch is a steal, especially given the quality of the food. The appetisers and desserts were great, but what really stole the show was the mains. The beef cheek was melt-in-your-mouth tender, and the grilled chicken and red snapper were perfectly seasoned. It's honestly difficult to pick a favourite dish, as each was well executed.

What truly set this restaurant apart, though, was the service. The staff were incredibly attentive without being intrusive, and brought us extra plates and utensils for sharing, even before we had to ask. A special mention goes to a gentleman from Nepal (I didn‚Äôt catch his name), who made sure we were well taken care of throughout the meal and checked in on us regularly.

While it may not be the most accessible spot to get to, it‚Äôs certainly worth the visit. We'll definitely be back if we get the chance.

Exceptional food at acceptable prices. We had dinner for 2 including a bottle of Veuve and our bill was around S$ 200 per person. We had the signature steak tartare and the grilled scallop as the starters. The steak tartare alone is worth the trip to the restaurant.

For our mains we tried the ribeye and the Branzini. The ribeye was cooked perfectly and the bearnaise was the best bearnaise I have had in Singapore. However the Branzini was the best dish we had by far. If you cook your own ribeyes, you might be better of trying their other dishes.

The service was not perfect, we had to top up our own glasses and we had to ask for steak knives after our main dishes were served. These are issues that can be solved easily . However we will definitely visit this restaurant again in the near future.

Lovely dinner experience on New Year‚Äôs day. Ordered the lamb cutlet which was really yummy as well as the eggplant parmigiana.

Service was excellent as well

Bottega Di Carna, Mondrian Duxton Hotel Singapore: Housed in the sleek-citing ultra luxe Mondrian Duxton Singapore, which is my fav playground in Singapore. While multiple visits to one spot isn‚Äôt my thing, I make a fine exception for Mondrian. Jungle Ballroom, Christina, been to them and now I tick Bottega off in my list. What a stunning space. Smart design ensures a fluid entrance into the restaurant, which welcomes you after you do your selfies in the stunning lift. No entrance. Just greeted by the expanse of stunning design. Some oxymorons - a pescatarian stepping foot into a butchers restaurant. We were here for a birthday, I burnt with excitement to plant ourselves in a luxe atmosphere. Pescatarian diet is possible in a luxe butcher's stop. We had the apperitvo set - drink with selection of fine cold cuts (not for me), cheese, olives and focaccia. Be sure to get the artichoke tarts - these tiny morsels pack taste bombs. Then calamari is perfectly fried and the spinach with fried egg is such a pleasing sight and the creamed spinach is a scream. We wanted to get seabass crudo but was full. On a sweet note, the birthday tiramisu was on the house, a surprise to me. The entire experience from top-notch ambiance, to food to service, is perfect. Mondrian Duxton deserves her queen spot in my book. #eatstylishtravelstylish

Reasonably busy for a midweek but exemplary service and equally delectable antipasti followed by delicious main. Definitely have the artichoke tart and beef tartare. Bistecca and tomahawk portions were generous and done to perfection (by that I mean medium). A must go place for respite from a hectic day only to be embraced by the cool vibe and soul enriching meal.

Hands down for the service! Special shoutout to the manager Mr. Burn and waiter Vinod! In case of any doubters, both are not our friends. But they have great heart to see their customer enjoyed the experience here. They‚Äôve been great service to us and we enjoyed having small chats with Mr. Burn and his hospitality although he was still busy serving around other customer.

Food was great truly! üòã

The perfect Italian steakhouse with a menu designed by legendary Tuscan butcher Dario Ceccini.   Mix of small plates and big grill items .  And a great selection of pastas of course.

Don‚Äôt miss the perfect calamari and original beef tartare.   Order 2 or 3 of the mains to share.   Pasta pic tasted like home made in Italy!

Reasonable prices.  Nice tight wine list.   Very relaxed atmosphere.

best restaurant i‚Äôve ever been to in sg !! in terms of the ambience , service (especially) and the food. We were celebrating our 1st year anniversary and I must say the staff really made our experience extremely memorable. A staff named Harry gave us complementary drinks and a cake , thank you so much, amazing service from him and all the other staffs !! All are so kind, attentive to food allergens and very welcoming I definitely recommend you to come here to celebrate any occasions, or if you want to go on a romantic date with someone .

Thank you guys so much for giving us a very lovely and pleasant time , the food was amazing too. We order the pichi pasta which had the most soft beef chunks ever , and the pork loin was relatively good too !! Do try the tiramisu if you have the chance. Will 100% come back , now I understand why you have such good reviews üòäüòä

Dinner, family of 3 with a 7 y/o child. The service by the floor lead and team was impeccable and excellent!

Sea Bass Crudo, we love this starter! Highly recommended!
Prosciutto, can't go wrong.
Halloween Special "Witches Cauldron Risotto", a pleasant surprise - the beef was tender and great!
Aus Wagyu Butcher Steak, it was good but didn't stand out as much as the starters and risotto. We might have spoilt ourselves too much before the main.
Tiramisu, a perfect ending.

Overall great experience as food was good quality and cooked well. Service was nice and attentive. Unique pasta dishes that were definitely worth a try!

‚ôøÔ∏è accessible

Opening in June 2023 as the in-house restaurant of the Mondrian Singapore Duxton hotel, Bottega Di Carna is a modern Italian restaurant offering an elegant, refined dining experience. Headlined by "The World's Greatest Butcher" and meat maverick Dario Cecchini, with Executive Chef Alastair Clayton and Chef De Cuisine Kenny Huang, Bottega Di Carna offers playful and creative plates that pay homage to the gourmet ingredients used.
.
Ambience at Bottega Di Carna calls to mind a Wes Anderson film set. Bright natural lights filter through the vast skylight, casting soft diffused light upon the gentle pastel coloured walls, marble-topped tables, and cushioned booth seats. Greenery within and without, quirky cursive fonts in the decorative wall scripts, and rounded mirrors lend the signature feel. A large open bar and open kitchen offers a view of the activity.
.
Service at Bottega Di Carna befits its status as a fine dining establishment. Staff accord each table personalised attention, demonstrating good product knowledge in describing dishes or beverages. They fulfil requests efficiently, and clean up quickly when diners leave. Great that they engage guests in conversation, and also check during the meal for feedback. Service recovery processes are decently defined and executed.
.
Food at Bottega Di Carna is modern Italian fine dining cuisine, with a focused menu comprising use of gourmet ingredients. No surprise that meat is a highlight, with exquisite aged cuts of beef flame-kissed by their josper grill. Handmade pastas and inventive appetizers round it out. Portions are sized for individuals but can be shared. Prices are relatively high, budget about SGD $97 per person for a meal with drinks here.
This is the place for steak. The pastas and the wines are great too. Can't say enough good things about Bottega di Carna. Shout out to Martin and the team. Love this place!

Excellent and sumptuous lunch BD celebration. Staff are passionate in what they are doing, impeccable food, wine, ambience and service. Thumbs up to chef and staff for making our day special with lots of cheers. Will certainly be back.

This got to be the best Italian Restaurant that I had been. All the food (Steak Tartare, Pici, Branzino Filet and Parmesan Fries and Aioli) that we ordered are very nice and the service is really top notch. Highly recommended.

Great meal! Had the 1.5kg tomahawk which was really yummy :) Received complimentary tiramisu and Prosecco for our anniversary from Danial who was one of our main servers of tonight! He was very helpful in taking photos for us and helping me pack the tomahawk bone which I wanted to bring home üòÜ Only downside is that the seats aren‚Äôt the most comfortable

Mondrian Singapore : Dinner Tasting with my bro

Bottega di Carna is the vibrant modern Italian eatery by Dario Cecchini, also known as ‚ÄúThe Greatest Butcher in The World.‚Äù

We were showcased a playful gastronomic experience and Italian classics with elements of Dario‚Äôs rebellious spin. A true expression of the Mondrian concept captivating community, heritage, art, fashion‚Ä¶ pillars of a modern globe..

Refined Dining comes alive at the latest modern Italian dining place by Dario Cecchini. We went to Bottega di Carna at the newly commissioned eloquent modern hotel right in the heart of Duxton, bringing excitement and life to this vicinity - the  @mondriansingapore which is a vibrant modern Italian eatery, the brainchild of Dario Cecchini, who is also known as ‚ÄúThe Greatest Butcher in The World.‚Äù

An entire array of playful yet delightful gastronomic Italian classics were showcased upon us with elements of Dario‚Äôs rebellious spin in an awesome culinary format. We sampled the SEABASS CRUDO consisting of grilled zucchini, lemon & marioram oil - so wonderful as I have not tasted anything like this before; the DARIO'S SIGNATURE STEAK TARTARE was amazing with a neat selection of smoked paprika, olive oil and lemon and the CARPACCIO DI CULO with seiso verde was just amazing!

The lovely Veuve Clicquot Yellow Label Champagne was a trustworthy companion that brought out finesse when paired with this bevy of starters combination.

For the main course, we chose the BRANZINO FILET comprising  grilled artichoke & salsa verde, exquisitely done and also the STOCKYARD RIBEYE 280Gm .. Australian Black Angus.. immaculate!

We couldn‚Äôt leave without dessert so we were given a taste of the VALRHONA CHOCOLATE FONDANT - a selezzione of cocoa nib tuile and homemade vanilla ice cream and also the TIRAMISU which is served at the table for two pax, love

Overall Rating : 9.3/10
Highly Recommended

New establishment within Mondrian Duxton. Loved the ambience and natural sunlight in the restaurant. Service was adequate and standards of food were rather good. Particularly enjoyed the lamb and tiramisu. Tiramisu is a must order.
Amazing service team leader by Martin.  Thank you for the 5 star food and impeccable service.
Delicious food, lamb, beef and fish are fresh , tasty, and real good. Service is excellent, setting is relaxed with view to the garden. Reasonable priced. Top quality restaurant.
Was there for a company event. The place is gorgeous and cozy, and the food was surprisingly good!

Probably one of my favorite places to dine at in Singapore! Service staff are always so incredibly attentive and amazing! I didn‚Äôt manage to get the names of everyone that was serving us however they never fail to impress! Martin is absolutely lovely and generous, as well as the hostess and Indian gentleman :) not to mention the quality of the food is consistently great every single time! The steaks and pasta are amazing, the atmosphere is just perfect even their playlist! Don‚Äôt miss out if you‚Äôre reconsidering dining here! A million thanks to the Bottega di Carna team & kitchen :)
Lovely ambience, friendly staff, great food. Martin was such a gentleman for moving our table back to some comfy seats while we were at the bar. Loved the steak, Burrata, calamari!!

My first time here with my family to celebrate my daughter‚Äôs 21st birthday. The service staff were exceptionally attentive. Big shout out to Hari who gave us excellent food recommendation and was exemplary in his service as well !

Super attentive and friendly staff. The restaurant is beautiful and perfect for special occasions. But just go for the food. The chefs are creating magic. Every dish we ordered was perfect. Easily my new fave restaurant in SG.
Great for both gatherings and date nights. Zucchini noodles were a hit and so was the ravioli with feta cheese. Definitely a must-try
Service was too notch. Enjoyed dining here. Excellent food selection.

Super IG able environment
Food is amazing with very good service. The wine we picked was not very good and manager even willing change for us. I‚Äôve been back twice since our first visit

Wonderful enjoyable lunch inn celebration of a friend's birthday. Very special  thanks to chef Alvin & chef Kenny for delicious appetiser, main course & dessert. Also thanks to Martin, Sherica, Biby & team for great service. Highly recommend this restaurant to all my friends and family.

Grilled scallop, chilli and lime - Fresh. Good sauce.
Branzino fillet, anchovies and caper oil - Excellent. Crispy skin. Fresh. Good flavours. Large piece.
Tiramisu - Good.

Savouring Italian dishes while in the lavish Mondrian Singapore Duxton? Yes, please! Bottega Di Carna promises a hearty variety of Italian eats by iconic butcher Dario Cecchini, who crafts his dishes with a hint of Tuscany. As the hotel‚Äôs flagship restaurant, you will be greeted with a glamorous interior that will make you and your group of friends feel like you stepped into a magazine.

Moving on to the food, any meat lover's dream dish will be their Crocchette Di Carne, known as their Wagyu beef croquettes and garlic aioli. But for starters, those who have a penchant for seafood might partake in their Seabass Crudo, which comes with grilled zucchini, lemon and marjoram oil. Ever heard of cucumber yoghurt before? You will be surprised at how it pairs so well with their Lamb Cutlets and eggplant caviar.

Also, check out their monthly signatures from time to time or catch their Sunday Roasts, Weekday Set Lunch, and Saturday Brunch menus to switch up your appetite occasionally.

Had a great time at Bottega! A welcoming space with cosy ambience and warm service. Enjoyed the conversations and bespoke drinks by Kai which had awesome flavour combinations. Excited to head back for their food items and drinks again.
Came to this nice restaurant at Modrian hotel located at Duxton Hill. Loved atmosphere and all the food served. Service was excellent.

New restaurant/hotel open in 2023, new and good ! The all day dining is Italian restaurant! Food is good and wonderful service!
The bartender Gary is helpful! They have home make limoncello! One of best in town!
Hari Saravanan and his team did a wonderful job to make sure that our orders and needs were taken care of ... The food n drinks were very good.
can‚Äôt wait to be back for the beef, service was great and tomahawk was perfect! desserts were alright, but I‚Äôll still return for the mains

Amazing diner ! Food is amazing, especially this Branzino filet, absolutely stunning !
Thank you Axelle for your professionalism and your advice!
An amazing lunch dining experience i had here. Food was great, service impeccable. Go for their ribeye steaks

Love the soft bread they Serve, the tuna salad every bite feel so healthy and pumpkin soup with sunflower seeds interesting combination. Fish was v nicely done live every bite. End with chocolate light cake. Best combination if all. Love it ü•∞ ‚Ä¶
