wanted to show my appreciation for the team at BdC after organizing a weekday company lunch. the team was responsive, the food delightful and the ambience was unforgettable. thank you BdC

‚ú®Great service, friendly staff.
‚ú®Stockyard grain fed ribeye (med rare), Pici
‚ú®Moody, bar-like interior with intimate setting
‚ú®Clean, well designed toilets.

üò¢pricey (but you get what you‚Äôre paid for)
Waitress kavitha was super attentive & nice. We enjoy her service as well as the food here! Will be back! Thank you! (;
Fantastic restaurant, amazing food. Service first class and lovely atmosphere. Requested a quiet table and was given a nice cozy spot. Shout out to Shiheng who was the perfect host for our table
Loved every dish I had the other day. Service was amazing. I would go back again.

celebrated my birthday here and had lunch. chairs were a little uncomfy and the lights give off some heat but all that was more than made up for by the excellent food and service! a really memorable experience! food tasted great and presentation was amazing. service was impeccable. special thanks to Martin Pandey who made the occasion one to remember.

Food was well made and enjoyable. I have fond memories of the pasta with very tender beef and the beef steak we ordered.

Martin made the whole dining experience very memorable. He made us feel comfortable and the energy he brought to the lunch experience was well appreciated. Kudos to him!
The food was great, the service was excellent. Would definitely come back again. Thank you for the experience

Celebrated a very important day here and everything exceeded our expectations.

The food was great, with exceptional service and recommendations from the staff.
The food was very reasonably priced for the quality and taste. Really enjoyed the Octopus, Beef Tartare, Pici Pasta and Tiramisu

The service staff were really attentive as well.

We had some enquiries about  venue bookings, and the manager Mr Maran very kindly spent time to talk to us in detail about all our questions and was very prompt with their follow ups.

Would strongly recommend a visit here

We simply enjoyed dinner.  We had the wagyu beef croquettes and the eggplant parmigiana- which was yummy!  The fish was too food!
But it was the service staff who made the whole dining experience memorable. Special mention goes to Hari - who explained  in detail whichever food u were gonna select.

And the ambience - sinply loved it! Wud definitely come back here even if its  just for their vast selection of red/white wine & startes.
Excellent food prepared by chef Alvin/chef Kenny and good service from the staffs Sherica/Vivy/manager.  Highly recommended to visit.
Celebrated a birthday there- really nice atmosphere, food (ribeye ravioli fries) were delicious!!!
Awesome delicious food !! Thank you very much especially Chef Alvin and Chef Kenny  üòãüòã Great service  from n  Biby ü•∞ will more friends üòç Thank you !!
Excellent service, great ambiance and foodüòã Especially the PICI, trying the steak next!

Amin provided excellent service, and the food was delicious. The ambience is really cosy, as the restaurant incorporates a lot of glass windows, allowing natural sunlight to provide a warmth to the restaurant. Would go again!
Lovely Restaurant Manager who takes care of your overall experience and quality of food. The atmosphere is amazing and not loud during dinner rush. The food is delicious but a bit punchy.
fillet mignon was so good, wonderful service team!

Had a really enjoyable dining experience at BDC! The food was great, with zucchini noodles, pici and tiramisu as particular standouts. As a pasta person, the pasta dishes are very traditional Italian (all handmade of course) focusing on the freshness and quality of the ingredients rather than being too ‚Äúovercrowded‚Äù with ingredients in other lesser Italian restaurants. Service was spectacular and in particular, Burn was fantastic - naturally charismatic and pays good attention to what your preferences and recommending complementary dishes. All in all a great night!
Amazing service by Gary and team! Food was delicious too - the Branzino fillet in particular. Beautifully designed space, pity the room was a tad too cold with the AC blasting at high levels.
had a super lovely time here, staff were all amazing and food was really good for the price, keen to come back! love the greenery and the overall vibe of the place
I loved the steak tartare and the 500 g angus Striploin

Had a great dinner at Bottega di Carna. Great steak, beef tartare and pici (pasta).

Special shout out to Vinod for his amazing service. He was attentive and had great recommendations for our dishes and wines. We enjoyed our dinner and are looking forward to returning soon!

Pricy but food and wine are good.
Take note that they have a dress code.

I have to say that the service was impeccable. All the floor staffs were attentive to diners needs. I like to personally commend floor lead Mr hari saravanan for his examplary customer satisfaction in handling diners feedback. I order their signature steak tartare, ribeye steak. My pasta was frst delivered uncooked and he promptly had it recook again. After ending the meal. He asked if everything was OK. I told him the pasta was still not exactly good and he offered to extend me some desserts which I kindly refused as I'm not a dessert person. After handling the bill he offered to write off the pasta and i tried to politely decline and say it doesn't matter. He took it in his stride that he wants to offer diners the best. Such examples are rarely seen in today's restaurant dining. His willingness to serve and offer a complete dining experience was heartwarming. I have yet to try other other food on the menu. Will definitely be back again.
Harry at the breakfast buffet has provided some of the finest service we have encountered on our many worldly travels. Definitely an 11/10 for every aspect.

Harry and Sini were very helpful. The best service I could have asked for.
I was so impressed, we will definitely recommend this hotel to all our friends. They made us feel so appreciated.

Went there once during chinese new year eve, loved the atmosphere and the very accommodating waiters and waitresses.
Went once again in march for a birthday dinner, glad to say the staff were very accomodating with us bringing outside cakes in and even offered to cut it for us
Good place to come for meals
Bold in its private little way, albeit a stark contrast from the person it was famous for.

I had a wonderful dining experience at The Halia in the Botanic Gardens. The grilled focaccia was perfectly crisp and flavorful, a delightful starter that set the tone for the meal. The pan-fried mixed greens were fresh, beautifully seasoned, and cooked to perfection.

Beyond the food, the ambience was serene and inviting, making it a perfect spot to unwind surrounded by lush greenery. The service was impeccable‚Äîattentive and friendly without being intrusive.

Highly recommend this gem for anyone looking for great food in a tranquil setting!

I had an unforgettable dining experience at The Halia Restaurant. From the moment we arrived, the ambiance was serene and welcoming‚Äînestled in the lush greenery of the Botanic Gardens, it truly felt like a hidden gem.

We were celebrating my boyfriend‚Äôs birthday, and the staff went above and beyond to make the evening feel special. Their thoughtful touches and attention to detail truly made the celebration memorable.

The service was warm, attentive, and professional. The staff made us feel well taken care of without being intrusive, and their knowledge of the menu was impressive.

As for the food‚Äîabsolutely delicious. Every dish was thoughtfully presented and packed with unique flavors. The signature Halia chili crab pasta was a standout‚Äîperfectly spiced and beautifully balanced. The desserts were equally memorable, especially the ginger nougat parfait which offered a lovely twist.

Highly recommend The Halia for anyone looking for a peaceful, elegant dining experience with great food, top-notch service, and a beautiful setting‚Äîespecially for special occasions. We‚Äôll definitely be back!

We recently celebrated our wedding at The Halia Restaurant (The Villa & Batik Ballroom), and it was truly a memorable experience for us. It was a joy to share this special occasion with our family, relatives, colleagues, and friends.

Lydia, who was in charge of events, was  patient and helpful throughout the planning process. She consistently went the extra mile to assist us, especially when there were changes to our plans.

The food was excellent‚Äîmany of our guests shared that they thoroughly enjoyed it. A special thank you also goes to John and his team for their outstanding service. We felt very well taken care of throughout the celebration.

Overall, we are extremely happy with our experience at The Halia. The team truly exceeded our expectations, and we highly recommend this venue for any event, especially weddings.

Celebrated birthday dinner here and the ambience is just perfect. Food quality is delicious with portion made for two. Jeremy has been amazing and very attentive. He took care of us from the beginning until the end along with his other colleagues. Five stars for the amazing experience given. Won‚Äôt hesitate to return again the next time!

We had an absolutely wonderful experience at The Halia while celebrating my mom‚Äôs birthday with a group of seven. Although we initially didn‚Äôt realise that the weekend brunch menu differs from the weekday lunch menu, the staff (Malay lady with coloured scarf, without glasses) went above and beyond to accommodate us. One of our favourite dishes wasn‚Äôt on the brunch menu, but the team graciously checked with the chef‚Äîand to our delight, they made it happen!

The service was impeccable throughout‚Äîwarm, attentive, and thoughtful. They even assisted us with wheelchair access for my mother-in-law, making sure she was comfortable and well taken care of. These small touches made our celebration truly memorable.

The setting, the food, and most importantly, the care from the staff made this a perfect afternoon. Highly recommended for anyone looking to dine with heart and hospitality!
Lovely place to dine after walking in the hot Singapore Sun! Beef ribs were so good! Hallibut with rice was divine. Special shoutout to Jeremy who was our waiter for his amazing service and humour.

I'm so grateful for this special dinner with the people who matter most in my life. This place is perfect for celebrating love and connection. Thank you for making it happen Mr Wee, Family & ThaiPore.

The food and ambience was great! Good vibes and good food! But what made the experience even better was the service given to us by our server, Fikri. Promptly taking our orders and offering recommendations, to helping my parents prepare a birthday surprise for me in the form of dessert and a candle! üòä Thanks Fikri and Halia for making my 23rd a special one ü§ç

Great customer service. Kumar was very nice and friendly and constantly checked on us throughout

Lamb loin was amazing, melt in your mouth tender. Angus was okay. Pan roasted mushrooms: some of the roasted mushrooms had a burnt aftertaste so was not the biggest fan

One of the best spots in Singapore for a refined dinner in an exotic environment, in the middle of the botanic garden.
I have put 5* for all since the service is excellent, food good quality and price very competitive ($60+ for the 3 courses menu). Just note no alcohol because it's halal

One of the most nicest and memorable dining experience  I've ever had. Love the delicious food especially the rib eye and smoke salmon. Marvellous  and friendly service by Mr Jeremy. Thank you for the ice cream given to my son on his birthday. ü•∞üòãüòãü•∞

Great tasting food and excellent service!
I loved the cumin, ginger and cinnamon juice fusion! Sir Ryan is a great host and so hospitable.
The food is superb!!!

I had a wonderful experience at this restaurant! The food is 100% halal and absolutely amazing ‚Äî every dish was flavorful, fresh, and perfectly prepared. The atmosphere was cozy and welcoming, and the service made the experience even better. A special thank you to Rayan, our waitress, who was incredibly kind, attentive, and professional ‚Äî he made us feel truly taken care of.

Highly recommended for anyone looking for delicious halal food and outstanding service!

Organised a company dinner here. Seamless service from start to end. Delicious and filling 3-course dinner. Recommended for intimate weddings, parties and other events. Shoutout to Jenn, Mazni and Nabil for the great assistance in making our event a success!
Great meal after a walk in the botanic gardens. The mushrooms were really good we got two of them:) The atmosphere is quiet and nice, definitely recommend! Thanks to John for the nice service!
Took us a while to reach the restaurant as we walk all the way from MRT station. Greeted by friendly staffs with nice food and atmosphere. Will come again.

Our 3rd visit here. It was raining heavily that night, so Francis called ahead to tell us so and remind us to bring an umbrella. Short of actually sending a valet service to pick us from the car park, it was indeed a nice touch. Food has improved significantly from before. We ordered 4 mains  - crab spaghettini, halibut, chicken and the ribs and 2 light mains - pulled beef and burrata. Loved the spaghettini, halibut and the chicken, ribs were so so.. or could it be because we were already quite stuffed when it was finally served? :). Service was excellent from John and Chan - Attentive without being intrusive. New plates were changed fairly frequently. Atmosphere could have been better had it not been raining - they had to put the blinds down to stop the rain from coming in but it still was rather cosy with nice subtle lighting. Thoroughly enjoyed the experience this time around. Thanks to John, Chan, Francis, the chef and staff of the Halia again for making it a nice night out for the family.

Had an amazing experience at Halia restaurant. The food was so delicious. We had the lamb, truffle fries, octopus and halibut. The lamb was cooked to perfection. It was soft and seasoned quite well. The staff was nice and made guest feels comfortable. The whole ambience was cozy and warm.

Actually, there is not many halal restaurants that really taste good. But today I am so surprised that The Halia actually deliver it so well. Good environment, great service, food is amazingüëçüèª truffles fries is so good, steak done very well , flavourful and tender. Dessert was good too but quite small portion.

Will definitely come back again

P.s: just small recommendations, due to the main dish portion is small. Maybe can serve some complimentary bread stick , etc. it will improve the dining experience and compromising on the small portion of the main dishes.
Love breakfast so much. Bacon and sausage not too salty. Bread soft and has nice crust. Love vibes bf in open

Certainly worth a visit if in Singapore‚Ä¶
Choices abound - and prices are reasonable considering the high profile of this food destination.
Great that you can just leave an item to secure your seat whilst making choices (I left my backpack) and know it is safe.

A must-visit hawker centre in the heart of Chinatown, packed with history & local flavour. From the legendary Hainanese Chicken Rice to handmade Fuzhou oyster cakes & hearty porridge stalls, there‚Äôs something here for everyone. It‚Äôs open-air & gets crowded during lunch, so come early or in the evening for a more relaxed experience. Bring cash & come hungry!

The place boast many good food. So it isnt fair to rate it on what we ate...
We went with the intention to try their "western" food, seeing how the Q snakes all the time.

We tried from:
Â§úÊù•È¶ô (Ye Lai Xiang Tasty Bbq) - chicken chop (juicy!! The sauce's flavours really good too!) And fish and chips (crispy and flavourful. soft, note not mushy, inside) portion's huge and price reasonable as well.
Chicken chop was 9.50
Fish and chip 10.00

2) taste. Fusion hainaness chicken chop.
Salty. Eaten w rice is fine.

I came here on a mission,to try what many call the best Hainanese chicken rice in the world. The line was long, but totally worth it. The chicken was tender, the rice fragrant, and the chili sauce packed just the right punch.

The entire hawker centre is filled with delicious options, but this one stall stood out. You can feel the energy and passion from the staff, and the food speaks for itself.

If you‚Äôre visiting Singapore, don‚Äôt miss this. Just be prepared to queue!

Maxwell Food Centre is hands down one of the best places to experience authentic Singaporean hawker food‚Äîa true paradise for anyone who loves bold flavors, local culture, and hearty meals at unbeatable prices.

Right in the heart of Chinatown, the vibe is buzzing yet welcoming, with locals and tourists coming together over steaming bowls of noodles, sizzling satay, and world-famous Hainanese chicken rice. And yes, Tian Tian Chicken Rice lives up to the hype‚Äîmoist, flavorful chicken, fragrant rice, and a chili sauce that hits just right. It‚Äôs legendary for a reason.

But what really makes Maxwell stand out is the variety. From crispy Fuzhou oyster cakes to comforting fish soup, laksa, dim sum, and even fresh sugarcane juice, there‚Äôs something here to satisfy every craving. I loved that many of the stalls have been run by the same families for generations‚Äîyou can really taste the passion in every bite.

The food is incredibly affordable, portions are generous, and everything is served fresh and fast. Seating is communal and casual, which only adds to the charm‚Äîjust grab a tray, find a seat, and dig in.

If you want to eat like a local and experience the soul of Singapore‚Äôs food culture, Maxwell Food Centre is a must-visit. I‚Äôve been twice on this trip alone, and I‚Äôd go back again in a heartbeat.

Rating: 5/5

Food lovers delight and easy to browse everything before deciding. One of the cleaner food centres and easy intro spot for tourists. Tian Tian wasn‚Äôt opened at the time but we followed another queue for Haianese chicken rice and it was fabulous. Lots of noodle options and refreshing drinks for the kids. Would return.

Delicious food, went there for lunch. Too many to choose from. Wanted to try everything üòÇ
Finally tried store 35. They make delicious fried oyster omelette üòã
Will be back for more next time

Probability on of the best food centre in Singapore. Usually crowded, but the food is quite good. A lot of dealers do not take Mastercard or Visa, so make sure to have some cash. There are two ATMs so no problem withdrawal on place. Also a good place to meet new people. Enjoy.

What a banger of a place! Absolute chaos, heat, smells and vibes!

Go with anything - you won‚Äôt be wrong once! However, Hainanese chicken is ‚Ä¶

I came here for a late breakfast. Not all of the vendors were open but we still had a lot to choose from. We decided to try Laksa, popiah and hainanese chicken rice. Everything was delicious (especially the chicken). Service was fast and prices low. Amazing atmosphere

Visited Lau Pa Sat during the famous Satay Night and it was such a memorable experience. The whole street transforms in the evening‚Äîfilled with the smoky aroma of freshly grilled satay, lively crowds, and that unique Singapore food market vibe.

Of course, we had satay, which was perfectly grilled and paired with rich peanut sauce. We also tried other stalls and ordered sugar cane drink, mango sticky rice, and luncheon meat fried rice‚Äîall tasty and worth it.

It‚Äôs not just about the food, but also the ambience. The energy, the flavors, and the mix of locals and tourists make it a must-visit when in Singapore.

An open street food inside an open dining food hall. The food options are plenty and food is really good. You can't go wrong and we ordered from the popular and less crowded stalls and to our surprise, some of the less popular stalls are really good too. Sorry for the eaten food in the pictures but I was really hungry üòã

There are so many choices here‚Äîyou definitely won‚Äôt be able to try everything in one visit. I‚Äôve been here three times, and every food and drink I‚Äôve tried has been absolutely delicious.

People say this place is also famous for its accommodations, though I haven‚Äôt had the chance to experience that yet.

It‚Äôs always busy and packed with people, especially during mealtimes, so finding an empty seat can be a bit of a challenge.

Literally the best hawker that serves so many of us during weekday lunch time and turns into a lit satay party during the nights. I enjoy their hokkien mee and Butter & Cream the best. Just try as much of their food as possible!

The food is great and the atmosphere fantastic. There were so many choices to eat, we decided to purchase from different hawker stalls and share. I can see why this establishment is so popular, the building itself is a work of art.
Very lively hawker. Loved satay street! We liked it so much we went twice. Take your time and walk around to all of the stalls. Try stall 8 for satay! It picks up a lot after 7 or 8 pm!

Lau Pa Sat is a must-visit in Singapore! There were so many food stalls to choose from, and everything we tried was absolutely delicious. The variety was impressive ‚Äì something for every taste ‚Äì and the food came out surprisingly fast despite the crowds. The lively atmosphere and historic setting made it even better. A fantastic spot for authentic, affordable, and tasty local eats!

This place is so insanely good - you literally have tens of different booths with every possible Asian quisine there is - and some of them are just masters of their trade. Like the one with chicken rice. Man, this is a religious experience. Or like 20 years ago there was this Korean grill place. I was so disappointed not to see it again, but then I went all around and guess what? Found at least ten booths with amazingly good food. And I never tried even a quarter of them. Not enough time and my stomach is not big enough. Ask anything, if they speak good enough English, they will explain. If not, not to worry. Just get a small portion, it most probably will be worth a try.
And the prices! Man, it‚Äôs such a great value!!!

One of the most popular Food Centre you must visit in Singapore, well known by local and tourists.
Come in after 7pm to the satay street to enjoy the satay, BBQ prawn and many... and embedded in the fantastic ambience.
There are many local and foreign delight to be discover here.

Such fun!!!
Satay street out the back.
All sorts of cuisines inside.
Yum. We were repeat visitors.
Atmosphere, atmosphere, atmosphere.
Open 24 hours.
Options for breakfast, lunch and dinner!!!
Knock yourself out!

Lau Pa Sat is one of my favorite food courts in Singapore. There are so many food options here and the whole place is lively and full of energy. Today I tried grilled stingray with curry paste. At first, I didn‚Äôt even realize it was stingray until my friend told me, but it was seriously delicious. The curry paste tasted like Thai panang curry, but milder. It came with a dipping sauce that reminded me of Thai chili shrimp paste with a sour and salty kick and bits of shallot. I loved it so much I wanted to bring some home.

I also had grilled chicken wings with crispy skin that felt almost like roast duck. And of course, we had mixed satay with pork, chicken, and shrimp. We ordered a small set, and even with three people, we couldn‚Äôt finish it all. The satay was really good and there are so many stalls to explore. I also tried the garlic fried prawns and they were packed with flavor.

If you‚Äôre in Singapore, this is a must-visit spot. Great food, local vibe, not expensive, and super satisfying.

We had an amazing food experience at Lau Pa Sat, especially at Best Satay 7 and 8! The smoky aroma from the grill was irresistible, and the satay was flavorful, juicy, and perfectly grilled. We tried both chicken and beef, and both were tender and well-marinated. The peanut sauce was rich and complemented the skewers perfectly. The lively street vibe added to the charm, making it a must-visit spot in Singapore for authentic local street food. Definitely a highlight of our trip!

It is the only hawker market I visited in Singapore, so I have nothing to compare it against.
But we had a great time there..!

The satay (stall 8) was delicious! Though the person controlling the line was quite rude to a lot of people.. But the meat was well cooked and worth the 10-15 min wait!

The entire area was bustling, crowded, and high energy with everyone having a good time!

The food inside the hawker market was amazing too!

Incredible choice and variety and very reasonable!

Overall it was a really fun experience‚Ä¶!

After visiting Singapore for over a decade, it seems ironic that this was only our very first visit to this iconic eatery and we had an incredible time. The decor and history of the site were fabulous and there are so many choices. It is very spacious with good ceiling height and ventilation. There is literally something for everybody. Although there were lots of people, it never felt crowded at all and you have choices to sit both inside or outside. We ordered a mixture of seafood, noodles and satay and all of them were delicious! We had an absolutely fabulous evening!

This review is for satay street alone, specifically stall 7 and 8. Yes, they're the busiest stall with a line. If you don't mind the wait (about 30 mins to get the food), then this is the place for you. If you don't like waiting , there's like 7 other stalls , some with more exotic items than others. I saw stall 6 had satay squid and coconut rice in addition to the normal chicken , beef , and shrimp. If I had more room I would've tried it!

As of the inside, there's plenty of seatings. If you like to be outside and have an ice cold beer, there's seats for that too! Do not miss out on lau pa sat!

Absolutely awesome and one of the best street food markets in the world, basically because is under a roof. As every street marked there‚Äôs plenty of vendors among tables and seats to eat.

This market serves most Asian dishes, specially focused on local dishes but not limited to Indian, Thai, Filipino and Chinese (among others)

Of course it‚Äôs a place to go eat affordable and fast dishes and although isn‚Äôt a reason not to leave 5* it gets overcrowded and it‚Äôs hard to walk around with a  tray

The vibes & atmosphere are amazing, esp at 7:00pm when the roads are closed for the Satay Club (Road), hot tip: order just before 6:45pm so that you get a table right at 7:00pm and you can start enjoying your meal quickly. Even as a local, I enjoy being here and appreciate the Lau Pa Sat experience. üëç

If you're a foodie like myself...Lau Pa Sat is not to be missed when you‚Äôre in SG. Me and my mom had dinner here and we had Fish Sauerkraut and it was just wow! For the price of about $25 nothing else to ask. Hawker food  is unlike anything I've experienced.

Absolutely awesome and one of the best street food markets in the world, basically because is under a roof. As every street marked there‚Äôs plenty of vendors among tables and seats to eat.

This market serves most Asian dishes, specially focused on local dishes but not limited to Indian, Thai, Filipino and Chinese (among others)

Had the sugarcane juice after that and that was the very first time I have had it. My gosh travelling really makes you try different foods /drinks you have never had before!!

This is my first time visiting Singapore. I was walking from my hotel looking for halal food, and I'm amazed by how inclusive Singapore is. It's a very informative country‚Äîthey even separate halal and non-halal food.

Lau Pa Sat is like a food court with a lot of food choices: Chinese, Japanese, Indian, Indonesian, Malay, and Western cuisine.
If you're a Muslim, just look for the halal logo, it is easy to spot. Or you can just ask them.

The food is good, although I've only tried one dish so far.

Most of the food here is self-service. You place your own order, and you need to return your food tray to the designated area based on halal or non-halal categories.

It was raining, but in the name of food, my husband and I still went to Lau Pa Sat‚Äîno regrets! I love the place! It‚Äôs clean, lively, and packed with so many food options. There‚Äôs Korean, Thai, Malaysian, Indian, and even some Middle Eastern food (I think?). I even spotted a Filipino stall, which was a nice surprise!

The place was absolutely jam-packed, but that just made it feel even more exciting. There are also lots of drink options, including alcoholic ones, so you can really enjoy the vibe. Overall, it‚Äôs a must-visit if you love food as much as I do!  Sorry I only took a few photos.

‚ÄúA food paradise in the heart of Singapore!‚Äù
Lau Pa Sat is a must-visit. The satay street that comes alive at night is iconic ‚Äî smoky, lively, and full of flavor. So many food options, from local faves to international picks. Affordable, authentic, and always buzzing!

Good and can enjoy food with different type. Singapore food, Chinese, Indian, Japan, Arabic and so many different food items can be enjoy with great variety. Also sweet items, coffee and tea, different juices are available. Can enjoy a lot. Also sathe are available to enjoy.
Great food options on a budget. We had dumplings and hot pot. The place is much cleaner than all the hawker streets I have been to in Singapore.

Great Hawker centre, I highly recommend.
Amazing authentic & delicious food at every stall.
Can get very busy but worth it.
Only been in Singapore 2 days and been twice and will return.

Fantastic dining experience in Singapore CBD. It has amazing food and drinks. It offers classic food and some exotic food but for me I searched for Vegetarian and had a good bite of Indian Biryani. Lots of foreigners and office employees visit. It seems like it's a great hang out place for CBD office gangs as well as for those who like to visit Merlion afterwards in which we did. So it's a great combination to visit Lau Pa Sat and after that we walked to One Fullerton area and Merlion place. Evening stroll is amazing and the weather was nice for us. From Merlion side you can potentially see the music water fountain from Marina Bay Sands as well. What a wonderful sight to visit especially after fulfilled dinner at Lau Pa Sat.

One of the famous hawker in Singapore, located in the city center and easy to reach. There are many choices of food ranging from snacks to heavy meals. My favorite here is Best satay no.7 & 8 for dessert there are Butter & Cream and Munchie pancake.

We had dinner at Lau Pa Sat today and it was amazing. I love this concept of hawker centres which bring together numerous sellers doing multiple cuisines which not only offers choice of food but also provides the convenience. We had a mix of black pepper crab with vegetables, mix duck and rice, chicken beef and prawn Satay with Won Ton noodles. The food was reasonably priced and is made fresh. A great way to have dinner out, the only complaint is the heat which on a night like today will get extreme. Highly recommend a visit there.

We had a great time with friends. Easy to get tables. Lines are reasonable and do not get too long. Priced reasonably compared to other establishments. Great selection of food. Clean and neat environment.

Expect it‚Äôs crowded and noisy. But overall, great place to explore food.

A must go for all foodies out there. Has a diverse choices of restaurants to choose from. All dishes you like to try will surely be available here. Drinks are also available and there lots of choices to choose from. They even close a portion of the street for the rows of satay bbq stalls. So fantastic and festive feel and ambience.

There was a party vibe on the satay street that was like a huge party in the middle of the street. There is a lot of smoke on the street, and it can be seen and smelled from a long distance away. As we ordered satay sticks from 'Best Satay 8,' all the other satay sticks that we tried were equally good and not different from the one we ordered. So many options for drinks on different stalls. The satay sticks were so good that we ordered like almost 50 of them.

Adam Food Centre is one of to go-to whenever I‚Äôm craving local food. So many great stalls in one place ‚Äî from nasi lemak and mee goreng to satay and prawn noodles. Everything is packed with flavour and reasonably priced. It gets busy, especially at night, but totally worth the wait. The vibe is lively, and there‚Äôs plenty of seating. A proper makan spot for sure. Highly recommend if you‚Äôre in the area!
Nice and cozy hawker center. The foods are delicious and value for money.

was here with friends for early dinner (around 5pm-ish). the place wasn't crowded (yet) during our visit. just feel that the quality of food is not as good as before and compared to the ones in newton.
what we ordered:
seafood fried rice (from the chinese stall). it was tasty enough. however i think the seafood wasn't fried together with the rice. it was placed at the bottom.
satay and bbq chicken. the taste was good. chicken satay was juicy but the mutton and beef were quite hard to chew.
stingray was also good. i like it spicy that way.
fresh lime juice was a little too sweet. but probably just had to wait a while more for the ice to melt so it'll be less sweet.
overall the meal was okay.

"Nasi Singapura" stall #3 (bright yellow signboard) within this food centre, serves THE BEST nasi lemak in Sg in my opinion...their sambal is superb! Brought me back to my childhood in pri sch where sambal used to be solid, more spicy than sweet than it is nowadays. The abang and kakak in the stall also super friendly and best part, dont stinge on the sambal.
Whatever Ingredients u wanna add to nasi lemak dont matter so long as u have the rice n sambal...ENJOY!

Adam Road Food Centre, established in 1974, has a rich background as one of Singapore‚Äôs most beloved hawker centers. Conveniently located near the Botanic Gardens, it‚Äôs a great spot for late-night food and my favorite hawker centre of all time. Famous for dishes like the iconic nasi lemak from Selera Rasa and the rich mutton soup, this hawker center also offers a wide range of local favorites, including satay and mee goreng. With affordable prices, a clean and bright atmosphere, and generally available parking, it‚Äôs a must-visit for both locals and tourists.

Free sitting, usually no chopping of table. No cooking smells in the hawker centre, Cleaners are efficient, well manner. Simple food favour by many. Repeat visits as Hawkers have a good attitude. Price is affordable. Parking is easy, Public transport is convenient.

Adam Road Food Centre- a place to get cheap local food.
Wide variety of local yummy food.
I am here for the prawn noodles. There are also a lot of other food to try, including halal food.
The place is clean, all thanks to the super efficient cleaners.
Maybe a bit warm in the afternoon, best to sit at the table near the fans. And luckily, there are many fans around.

Do note of the queue during peak period and the need to queue for a car park slot as well.
Best to avoid the lunch crowd!

A sure must go place to eat!
Strongly recommended.

If you‚Äôre a fan of nasi lemak, this hawker stall is a hidden gem you absolutely need to try. The coconut rice is fragrant and fluffy, cooked to perfection without being overly rich. The sambal is the real star ‚Äì slightly sweet, with a nice spicy kick that lingers just enough to make you crave the next bite.

Their fried chicken is crispy on the outside and juicy inside, well-marinated and full of flavor. The ikan bilis and peanuts are super crunchy, and the egg is always cooked just right. Everything is served hot and fresh, even during busy hours.

Portion sizes are generous for the price, and the service is friendly and efficient. Whether you‚Äôre here for a quick lunch or a hearty breakfast, this nasi lemak will hit the spot. Highly recommended for both locals and tourists looking for authentic local flavors!

Adam road food centre has really good prawn noodle! it is slightly pricey at $12 for the big prawn but it‚Äôs quality prawn and broth justify the higher pricing. Would be better if they give more soup as it is really addictive haha. Tried the mee gorang got surprised by the wok hey taste. Awesome skills

Amazing variety of food even though not all the stalls were open at certain timings. Some popular food would be the seafood, prawn noodles, oyster omelette, Indian food and nasi lemak, and many more! Bright and clean atmosphere during the day and night, with parking directly outside
Many lasi lemak options available, many excellent. There‚Äôs a stall that names its sets after poker game hands which I usually buy from.

This place was packed despite CNY.  I went to Nasi Singapura stall and managed to order nasi lemak,which was still delicious, after all these years. My kids did not like the hokkien mee and carrot cake but one cannot expect a lone worker to perform miracles. Place looks small but if u know what to order u will be satisfied.

A medium size hawker centre with a good variety of food choices - chicken rice, seafood bbq, satay, nasi lemak, rojak, mutton soup, mie soto, prawn noodle, etc.  Good choices of typical drink stalls, fruit juices, and desserts (ice kacang, tau suan, green bean).

Plenty of tables and usually can find an empty table unless it's weekend lunch time.  Parking can be hard to find at time as it's a small lot.  Across the bridge from the Botanic Garden and a convenient stop after walking in the garden.

Tried Teck Kee Hot & Cold Dessert, Fruitopia, Selera Rasa Nasi Lemak, Warong Pak Sapari Mee Soto & Rebus and they are good.

Lots of malay and indian stores with halal options. Home to legendary nasi lemak and mee soto store. There are basins to wash your hands. Mostly breakfast and lunch crowd

The drinks stores will approach you for business so usually there is no need to queue for drinks

Always a place to go for hawker food. Serving mostly halal foods the Indian rojak is a can eat. Nasi lemak, kambing soup, satay are good choices. The Fish ball noodle from a non halal store is also a can try!
Finally opened after closed for quite some time. Place had been renovated and cleaners are more efficient. Food taste just like how it used to.
The best avocado ever !!!! Got real fruit juice/ and premium series a lot of type of smoothie ü•πü•π everyday my family have to drink hereüòªüòª

No aircon but airy with many fans. A wide range of yummy food, award winning ones. A concentration of hawker flair. üòã

Tiktok: SA Soln
IG: sgfood13
Tasty ! The chilli uplifted the nasi lemak to a next level. üòã
Offer wide range of Chinese and Muslim food, including the two famous Nasi Lemak stalls,  Michelin Bib mutton soup, Mee Soto, and the delicious big prawn noodle.

Easily accessible by bus or mrt. Food is good. Not only the famous Nasi Lemak.
This prawn Mee cost $6. It is expansive compared to the rest of the stall. I think others with the same pricing taste much better.
The Indian Rojak is nice. Dessert store ice kacang $2.50 only. Very nice.

Lots of good food here, especially the nasi lemak. Place is generally kept quite clean. It may get quite crowded at times, and there are limited parking available. Other than that, definitely worth to come here for your meals.

Really amazing place even after so many years.
Food was great. The lack star was for a no so flavourful fish soup.
Carrot cake - OMG man. Fried to perfection.
Nasi Goreng combo was a real surprise and twist of innovation from the stalls.

Steady Pom PiPi.
Patrons have to return tray and the tables are cleaned up by the cleaners efficiently or just request them to clean up. Today I had yu kee duck dry kway teow. It simple and suits my taste buds.

Nasi lemak, mee rebus, mee soto, mee goreng mamak special with cheese fries, teh halia‚Ä¶ seriously food paradise.. special shout out to the mee rebus stall, amazing. had it due to my wife‚Äôs craving just before she popped..

Worth the queue! Crowded at peak lunch hour on a Saturday so come earlier or past 1pm for a shorter wait. Queues, seats and walkways altogether makes the area a tad cramped so I don't recommend coming with kids. The sugar cane juice and prawn noodle soup was good as well! So good that I forgot to take pictures ü§£

Nice small hawker center, good after trail walk in Macritchie, bus 10 minutes to reach Adam Food Center. Seems like the stall number #1 has very very nice Nasi Lemak.
Very clean bathroom.

Wow, the power avocado made it so easy for me to continue my ride to holland v. I just came from a hard ride from potong pasir. 3.50 and it‚Äôs enough to give a tasty boost! The milkiness and sweetness are well balanced. Well done muscle man.

Adam road food centre is small but still good selection of nice food.. mostly malay and indian food. Most stalls are closed on Monday too. Lunch time is packed so do go slightly early if possible.  Nasi Lemak, indian rojak and prawn noodle is a must to eat! Will be back to try the mutton soup!

Visited this stall in Adam Food Centre yesterday.  They have fried carrot cakes, Oyster egg, Char Kway Teow, Hokkien mee‚Ä¶ Ordered a plate of white fried carrot cake.  It was nice!  The carrot cake was not too soggy (some places I ate the cake was very soft and wet).  and it was not too oily and the egg was fried just perfect (to me lahüòÑ).  Saw people eating their char kway teow looks yummy too.  Will try next round!
Ordered mee goreng from stall number #16. Friendly cook n cook it to the way I wanted it. Charred n spicy .
The food there is great and there is a wide variety of it. I especially like the chicken rice and their freshly squeezed juice is the best . Would definitely recommend

Very good food, but cheap  only 3-5sgd dollars, tidy area, laksa, hainan chicken rice, nasi lamek, indian coffee, prawn noodle... All are good, have this great opportunity to be there, and the boss of the hawkers stall are nice... Worth to go
So much better after the renovation. New tables and chairs, big circulating fans, and more tray return counter. Food as usual are fantastic.

Adam's road nasi lemak was closed when I visited on Sunday. Few other shops seem to be closed as well.

Tried other shop selling chicken rice. It was tasty. I would go and buy again.

The other shop who sells chicken rice also tasty. It was wrapped with omelette. And the uncle was friendly. He gave my son wafer while waiting for the food to be ready.

Rojak was great but quite small portion for the price.

BBQ seafood and satay look very appealing however it look like it might take longer waiting time that I didn't order.
Love the famous fishball & laksa noodles here, my comfort food. Prices are reasonable and quality always consistent. service is always good.

I ordered a roasted chicken rice set from Hua Ji Hainanese chicken rice stall and Masala tea from one of the drinks stalls. Both were reasonably priced and tasted heavenly to a hungry soul. Despite being crowded at lunch time, the place was airy and well-ventilated. The availability of wash basins for washing our hands is much appreciated.

This place came into existence 3 decades ago and has gone through many rounds of upgrading projects. Clean and well organized, be it store sellers or the sitting arrangement. Good food and price is reasonable. When you are there you must not missed out 3 important stores, the BBQ seafood, dessert and the fresh fruits drinks (Avocado). Parking there can be quite challenging.
At Adam, the stalls owners treats everyone like family... The food there taste like home cook food. Especially the Nasi Lemak from Selera Rasa.

Many Attentive, hard working crockery collection staff. Tables are always super clean before next user. I drive, so visited many Food centers all over Singapore. Adam has Cleanest tables & toilets. Keep it up!

A small food centre which serves a small variety of foods. Though small, there should be something to eat for most people. A few of the famous stalls, like the ones selling duck rice, prawn noodles and Nasi lemak, can be found here.

Accidentally eaten the best kway chap in Singapore 2 weeks before writing this review. Stall no. 26 Yew Kee House of Braised Duck. I came back to take photos for this review. The braised meat is tender and flavourful. For $4.50 set, its a treat!

Great for local Malay breakfast dishes. I tried Selera Rasa's Nasi Lemak (Coconut Rice) today and it's nice!

Lots of other choices too but from lunch onwards. Breakfast more limited.

If you want a gastronomic experience, try this lad's fried oyster.

Michelin grade. Bar none.

A fantastic Hawker store to eat at!!!

The owner was a very friendly and kind woman and her employee/friend was a hospitable and nice man

Their Chicken and rice was fantastic and everything was home made,definitely check them out when in the Adam food centre thanks again Ms Guohua and all the best:)
Many halal stalls serving favourites Mee soto Nasi lemak Satay Rojak mamak and many more. Chinese and halal mamak stalls too. Deserts and drinks stall like sugarcane and chengteng ice kacang.

#22 for Carrot Cake!! #6 for drinks.

Very busy, internationally diverse hawker center with nice selection of local foods. Couldn‚Äôt decide which of the two long nasi lemak queues to join so I went for the chicken rice with a slightly shorter queue. Chicken was over cooked but flavorful and the rice was really nice. Picked up a carrot cake from the nice woman across the way. This carrot cake has since become one of my favorites. The chef only burnt it the first time but since he knows my face, each time has been great! Highly recommend. Overall, would happily return to this place but not at peak lunch hours.
Nasi lemak is a locals favorite.  Prawn noodles and fishball noodles are my own personal favorites.  Avocado juice is also a must.
Medium-size hawker centre. Famous stalls are the two stalls selling nasi lemak side-by-side, each with its own following. Another one is the prawn noodle stall.
When arrive almost all close, except mamak fried rice

A small food center that serves a variety of food. This place has been my daily go-to for quick meals. There are so many stalls but I recommend the roasted duck rice, fishball noodles, fish slice noodles, chicken rice and nasi goreng.

Sometimes if you arrive after 6p.m, most of the non-halal stalls are closed or closing. Hence, I going there at 5:30p.m.

A good hawker center near botanic garden! It's easy to get here, and they have various stall of foods and beverages. What impressed me is they separate places for halal and non halal food, so it will be save for moslem like me. Some of the stall were famous so be ready to have a long queue there.I always love selera rasa nasi lemak and also siti nur liyana mee rebus! So authentic and delicious..

was there for brunch and chanced upon a short Queue Mee Soto and Meet Rebus stall. No second thoughts, definitely a must eat dish at Adams
friend had Charkwayteow which was good too!

Tried the duck noodle. Shiok üëçüèø
Requested for large bowl of soup and i finished it!!
Will return to try other dishes.

Ordered Happy Duck Rice and Char Siew Roasted Pork Rice big serving and delicious.

For drinks, we ordered Michael Jackson Drink and Bandung Grass Jelly. Bandung Grass Jelly taste better, love it so much.

Love this Adam Road Food Center. The choices available is sufficient to cater for your tastebuds. Great place to handouts with friends and family. Must try the Zaiton Satay ($0.70 each for Beef/Mutton) as the satay is superb. The Teh Tarik at Thajudeen Teh Tarik is one of the best I‚Äôve ever taken.

Still the same good after renovations. Minus the birds. Much cleaner feel. Tried Siti Nur‚Äôs Mee Rebus for the first time. It‚Äôs actually very good. On par with Warung Pak Sapari‚Äôs. The 2 Nasi Lemak stalls at the corner seems to have dropped in standard (but queues are still long).

Fishball noodle stall was worth the try! Noodle was bouncy and flavourful, generous ingredients for $4! Portion was just enough!

Teh tarik from drink store has a floral fragrance and it‚Äôs not too sweet when I asked for less sugar!

Overall great experience, would love to come again!

This is a pretty cool food court. In the beginning, this red building does look ugly. Not pretty at all. However, this building has nice car park around this building so that people can bring their car here. Also, they have famous nasi lemak and shrimp noodle stalls which are hot place to eat. Also, for those who visit Botanic garden, thisnisnthe right place as it is closely located to Botanic Garden MRT station. Convenient place to eat something.
Nice place for cheap hawker food. I got chicken rice and prawn soup. Both very good.
Great pork prawn noodle
When in Singapore, you gotta do street food. This place is top. Try Adam's nami lemak and all the amazing satay.
One of my favourite hawker centres in Singapore and its not all about the famous Nasi Lemak. Many great stalls to choose from and the quality is always great
Small and convenient, all type of food even dessert

A small hawker centre near Botanic Gardens that houses a variety of delicious halal foods, such as Nasi Lemak, Maggi Goreng, and Mee Soto. Crowded for good reason. Great for a simple meal after a morning hike. Stalls start closing after lunch.
My favourite maggi goreng combo in the whole Singapore. The red signboard stall at beside one of the exits. Try it!

Good enough for hawker centre. Best food in-the area. The atmosphere bit noisy but ok. The food and the service is quick and fast. They have Satay,Chicken Rice and most famous their big prawn noodles soup. Haven‚Äôt tried that yet though. Bee Hoon is decent and it is relatively clean. Renovated recent. Love this keep it up.üòçü•∞

A long time since I go to Adam road Hawker centre. Still crowded though and limited carpark space. 2 entrance points,  Trace together and can seat up to 5people. Very limited seats also. Nasi Lemak queue still very long.
Great food at a very reasonable price. Boss was friendly and ready to custom to your level of spiciness.
Great place to eat different types of local food. The prawn noodles is quite famous. Quite a lot of people queue to eat it.  The Nasi lemak here is also famous.
Always delicious.. Their kambing sup IS SO GOOOOOOOOD. As well as combo, teh tarik, Indian and Chinese rojak w century egg. Satay and chicken wing not recommended
Good hawker centre, should visit.

It is busy place on weekends but it is a must stop during our annual visit to Singapore. Few things you must try here . 1. Selera Nasi Lemak 2. Teh Tarik or Halia 3. Mee goreng 4. Mee soto and 5 fruit juice
Having lunch at Adam road food center. Ordered chicken briyani and kopi to go along. Place is bustling with people üôÇ ‚Ä¶
Must try Power Avocado Fruitopia stall29. I tried Power Avocado and Dragonfruit Soursop snow nice and refreshing

Adam Food Centre is my go-to spot whenever I‚Äôm craving a comforting bowl of Noo Cheng Prawn Noodles. This place never disappoints. The prawn noodles here are famous for a reason‚Äîperfectly cooked noodles, juicy prawns, and that rich, flavorful broth that always hits the spot. It‚Äôs the kind of dish that warms you up and leaves you fully satisfied.

A tip for anyone visiting: come early or late if you want to avoid the parking woes. The food centre is quite popular, and parking can get tricky during peak hours. However, despite its popularity, Adam Food Centre never feels too crowded or too hot, making it a comfortable place to enjoy your meal. The open-air seating and well-ventilated space contribute to a pleasant dining experience, even when it‚Äôs busy.

No meal here is complete without a refreshing sugarcane drink from The Sugarcane Plant. There‚Äôs nothing quite like washing down a hearty bowl of prawn noodles with an ice-cold sugarcane drink. It‚Äôs the perfect way to recharge and feel refreshed, especially if you‚Äôre heading back to work. The combination of comfort food and a revitalizing drink makes for a fantastic lunch break.

Whether you‚Äôre a regular or a first-timer, Adam Food Centre offers a great selection of local hawker fare, with Noo Cheng Prawn Noodles and a sugarcane drink topping my list every time.
best place for nasi lemak in singapore. better than other places. like the sambal and fried chicken.
Its near and one of the oldest and famous food court that is still going strong  and food have variety to choose
Loved the nasi lemak, orh jian (best I've eaten in a while) and black carrot cake. Look out for the red signboard for orh jian and black carrot cake. Stall owners were friendly. Enjoyed my food! :)
Adam Road Food Centre have mostly Muslim food and some Chinese food. It is  slightly more expensive than other food centre. But worth trying. Would recommend the seafood Bee Hoon. ü§≠üëçüèª ‚Ä¶
Sad my fav store is not open

Went for the local-voted mee soto. Best top up with chicken gizzard. Serving is good.

Adam road reminds me of newton food cntre. In itself, there‚Äôs lots of sataaaay and malay and indian food inside.
SATAY STALL AND NASI PADANG SUPER DELICIOUS. INCUDING ALL THE GRAVY FROM BOTH STALLS.
Nice hawker center..i ate prawn noodle which is great..price is cheap..i have to queue though..in here also has nasi lemak stall which is also great..recommended
The refreshed Adam Road Hawker Centre is so clean and airy. Most importantly my favourate Mee Soto from Warong Pak Sapari is still power!
Love this hawker centre. The char kway teow ie fried noodle at this stall is genuinely great. Not too dry and not too moist. Service is great too. Very friendly stall holder.
The best place for your goreng combos here is at a stall named Al Sheik. Look them up! Won't disappoint you!
Good nasi lemak and very centralized location
Good and reasonably priced food. Selera Nasi Lemak as good as advertised.

It's a well know hawker center ..though not as popular as newton hawker centre. Lunch time fr 12 - 2 can be very crowded. Great for bfast with many varieties available. Mainly Indian , Chinese n Malay cuisine.  Tea break for as nice teh tarik or others with snacks is highly recommended. Dinner time aft 6 is also very crowded but worse over the weekend. So go for bfast , early lunch or tea
break.

Nice and convenient place to eat. Lots of Indian Muslim options including the increasingly rare Tulang Merah. Also one of the only places to get mutton soup with organ meat. It's also worth trying the oyster omelette (generous portion and good taste) and the avocado coffee from the juice stall.

First visit after its renovation last year. The food court is much cleaner & comfortable now. I m particularly impressed with the services of the staff and store holder there. My sister spilled a big cup of Teh Halia. You can imagine the big mess we created. The cleaner was very quick to help clean up the table & chair, and the stall holder came to offer us a replacement drink (with no charge).
We are proud that Singapore is offering such high standard of services level üá∏üá¨

The place is clean, plenty of carpark lots but little bit difficult to access by bus or mrt.
The food choices are many and the portion given are big. You should try the sup kambing (mutton soup). Delicious and affordable.
Most the food stall open for bisness at around 10 am on Saturday, Most of the good food stall are with long queue. Most of seat almost full.
Mutton Soup was the world's best.
The fishball noodle couple very warm and friendly. Food is good too!
Spoilt for choice! But the Kuey teow kerang (Cockles) at stall no.14 is definitely a must try! Love the teh tarik from taj mahal drinks stall!

Try different indian muslim food stalls on every visit and you'll discover your favourite üòÅüòÅüëçüëçüëç. That's what I did a long time ago.  Good choices of hot drinks,cold drinks and fruit juices. Friendly vendors. Food are well priced. Plenty of  Malay food to choose from, nasi lemak, nasi ayam , mee soto , satay and many more....Muslim owned btwüòÅ.
Must try Mamak Mee Goreng Combo..A mixture of Mee goreng ,mutton chop ,cheese fries and egg on one plate...

This is so far, together with Alexandra Village, my favourite hawker in Singapore.
Relaxing and local atmosphere, kind vendors, good food, clean, and only 5 min walk from Botanic Gardens. Tourists seem to come only seldom to this place, despite the proximity to the Botanic Gardens.
Nice foods and friendly environment
Sedap!! @ Selera Rasa Nasi Lemak. Be ready to queue ~30mins but the wait was definitely worth it ;)
Very good barbecue store here. Adam seafood BBQ. üëç
They have many halal food stalls here. They‚Äôre delicious and cheap.
Stall number 11. The best I've tried so far.. Highly recommended
Prawn Noodles, BBQ Sting Ray, Mutton Soup, Teh Tarik and tonnes of good muslim food. üòçüòçüòç ‚Ä¶

An iconic eatery since I was a schoolboy in the early 80s as my school is not far away along Dunearn road (DUNERAN SECONDARY TECHNICAL SCHOOL)
Had a reminisce affair with people there, the stall holders who some happens to be a 2nd and 3rd gen but the best magical part is the mee soto stall Haji Sapari was standing tall all these years and it happens to be my schoolmate Mr Azhari (2nd gen) who managing it now. Oh how this place brings back the good old wonderful years even serving my NS with SPF in the late 80s and it happens to be in Tanglin 'E' division sector this is our 'official' eatery other than TAMAN SERASI (BOTANIC GARDEN) food centre whenever I visited there will be lots of fond memories coming back from motorcycle gangs era til now oh wow..
I'm in my mid 50s
Those were the days where Singapore used to be a food heaven and you'll get spoiled with choices..
Oh I nearly forgot the wonderful auntie forgot her name who is very kind and very cheerful back then laa she sells fruit juices the stall is right behind the toilet when I was there in mid 90s I was told she was diagnosed with cancer but she survived till now..!!!ü§óüëçüëçüëç

Adam Road Food Centre has been a local favorite for a long time! What's not to like about all the comfort food in one place. The prawn noodles (Michelin Bib), the Nasi Lemak, etc.. with queues snakeing around the tables of hungry diners.

Except the lack of parking space, if you drive. And this small Food centre is hot and crowded, but that is expected.. the charm of a Food centre in Singapore.

Went for dinner here before our adventure to Botanic gardens. Cheese fries and roti john from one of the Indian shops were delicious and kids love it.  zaiton satay was closed so we bought Satay from the other shop and it was disappointing. Otherwise, nice place to have your dinner.
Fast serving food to customer and clean environment
The ambience was very nice. A lot of halal options. Food choices pretty limited but enough. Price is very reasonable as well.good place to dine for classic hawker centre ambience

Adam Food Center is a bustling hawker center that offers a wide variety of delicious local dishes. From the fragrant chicken rice to the savory satay, every bite is a flavor explosion. With affordable prices and a lively atmosphere, it's a must-visit for anyone looking to indulge in Singaporean street food.
Good place to get a bite of local food!
Great food, seating was abit hard to find to accommodate a large group during lunch rush but overall area is well ventilated with many well priced food available

I actually went there specifically for the nasi lemak but the stall was close so I ordered something else .it seems more stalls open at night I guess or lunch time not too sure because when I was there a few stalls were operating.
Mee rebus was really good, well the only mee rebus/mee soto stall there. Long q always, but worth it.
Good place to have a local breakfast.. famous for its Coconut rice ala Nasi Lemak.

Had the Adam's prawn noodle with pork belly. Long Q but fast. Putting a bit of the chilli powder ready give the soup a boost. Found some soft pork skin inside the soup- interesting as I like to eat them. Recommend not to order with pork rib as it will take away the real taste of the prawn.

Great place for breakfast if you craving for prata, nasi lemak, mi soto and other malay breakfast. freindly stall owners and also to mention that u can get good teh tarik there. Fo me, i usually go for masalah teh (this is a drink you dont commonly find).
Good food, hot place.
Ordered Stingray and Kangkung tdy. Was wonderful as always and tried Taj Mahal Teh Alia, not the old standard but still oküëå
I can't get enough of the Nasi Lemak at Selera Rasa Stall. The people working there are very friendly and   paired with the bustling atmosphere of the food centre makes my meal taste better.

A wide variety of vendors and cuisines.  Almost exclusively Asian cuisines(I don't remember any Western options) in an open-air (covered) Singapore traditional hawker center.  Every vendor is different but most would prefer you pay cash if they don't require it outright.

It's open-air which means it's hot.  It's also extremely busy so vendors are very business-like rather than chatty.  Many may not speak much English and be more conversant with customers who speak Mandarin or another language.  Order from the vendor you want and pay them directly, wait for your food and then try to find a table to sit at.  Great experience!

A typical hawker center with lots of selection.

Very crowded!  Maybe its a public holiday.
A wide selection of food ranging from Halal to Indian to Chinese.

We went that during lunch time but many stalls not opened. Due to Ramandan , most Muslim stalls are not opened yet. We enjoy the char kway teow n the oyster omelette. While my sister gobbled up the kway chap,  I had a bowl of lontong which is quite good.
Our helper was busy munching the Adam Penney. Good to karry on makan.
The size of this hawker is perfect. It is a very underrated area and I would highly recommend getting Carrot Cake, masala, tea, and Char Siew noodle.

Very delicious local foods in this Food Centre. Just cross the overhead bridge from Botanic Gardens MRT and you can have reasonable price foods here instead of spending a lots inside the Gardens. üòÅüëç
Had hainanese chicken rice which was good. Food centre was clean and tidy.

Adam Road Food Centre is definitely one of the few great supper stops I gravitate to when I've cravings. The wide variety of cuisine is also a strong factor that makes it easy for me to promote this to my foreign friends.

Good variety of food for all ethnicity and of high standard. A lot of famous store like Adam fishball noodle, Sera Rasa nasi lemak, cheng teng  Ssiti meed rebus and mee  soto, fried carrot cake and fried oyster omlett etc are all the must try here. Reasonably priced and of high quality

Visited this hawker centre after seeing an advertisement on social media. Truly a life-changing experience. The friendly All-E tray return robots with a great personality really made tray return easier! The environment was clean and cooling. I thoroughly enjoyed the performances by youths aged 15-18 as well. 10/10! Deserves an A for A Level Project Work!

Lots of food but very crowded place. Some stalls you need to queue for almost an hour for the food. Very small parking area as well. Love the prawn noodles. Have to queue for 30mins but no regrets. Soup is very tasty and prawns are very fresh. There is a new fruit stall selling avacado drink. Come and try it!
Very clean place and good price.

Always my go to place for Malay & Indian-Muslim food!

A must have whenever i'm there - Mee Soto from Warong Pak Sapari - the soup is rich and flavourful with nice aroma of spices. Paired with a bergedil by the side makes it a perfect breakfast or lunch!

For Satay, i find Zaiton or Pondok equally as good.

Not to forget Soup Kambing paired with roti from Bahrakath Mutton Soup..perfect on a cold rainy afternoon!

Location is easy to find, near the MRT station and accessible by buses too.

The bachor meepok nearest to the famous prawn noodle is excellent.  We stop eating from the "famous" prawn noodles..only the soup is not bad...otherwise over-rated and over priced. Tao suan is one of the better ones too. The 5 star-rating is for the bachor meepok n tao suan.

Super duper teh tarik.  Spoilt for choices.  Found a very good Indian rojak; hopefully the good food standard is maintained.  Also 2 sedap nasi Lemak stalls; standards always high whether you get fresh chicken or not... ü§£üòÖ ‚Ä¶
Has great seafood. Has one of the best Nasi Lemak in town. Indian food is good as well. The satay here is quite decent. One of the best places to have late supper.

Visit this location early in the morning before 8am. This was my first visit after more than 5 years. At this time, the place is relatively not crowded. Most stalls are already in operation. The nasi lemak stalls are popular here. Few of the stalls have long queue after 9am. Seating was also a problems after 9am. As all the early birds have occupied it. Most came in groups, due to this the seating is occupied. Some of the familiar stall holder are no longer around, which I learnt from my friends. The hassle of eating here are still around. Maybe will visit again this hawker centre after 5 years.

If you‚Äôre looking for a hawker centre filled with good food near Botanic Gardens MRT Station, Adam Road Food Centre should be on your list! Although it may be considered to be rather small, it is one of the most popular hawker centres in Singapore! From Nasi Lemak to Mutton Soup, and Rojak to Prawn Noodles, Adam Road Food Centre offers a range of multi-ethnic cuisines!

Adam Road food is one of the hidden gems in Singapore. The famous nasi lemak always finish early. However there are other stalls selling nasi lemak which is as good as the famous one.

Adam Road milk tea is the best. Must order this.

Very Nice place to eat Muslim Halal Foods.Many many items shop are here,
I tried many things.
There everything great.
You can relax and enjoy to eating.

When I went around 7plus pm , its was crowded but seating was still easy and I chope a table for my two other buds. I had kambing soup while I waited. A mix of good food, more malay/indian but chinese was well represented by a few staples. As mentioned food is good, if its not your stall will not be around there for long.

First time I'm here. Have been at a campus just across the street years ago and didn't know its existence! Think it's too well-hidden cos you couldn't really see it when you're on a bus, haha!
Anyway, it's a real delight to find so many Nasi Lemak/Nasi Padang stalls at one place. Since  there's a long queue at the famous Nasi Lemak stall, and I didn't want to miss my transport rebate, I da bao from the stall just beside it. Not bad at all!

Popular Mutton soup , well known Nasi Lemak & Former Chong Pang Indian Muslim food Stall is located here ...
Chicken / Mutton Briyani among new dish available at the Mutton Soup stall ...
Delicious foods & all sorts of cold & hot drinks available too ...

This is a go to place if you love Malay food and Indian Food. Plenty of good tasting variety.
Malay Food - Nasi Padang, Lontong , Mee Siam, Mee Soto, Mee Rebus, Nasi Lemak, Satay, Malay Chicken Rice.
Indian Food - Briyani RIce, Prata, Murtabab, Indian Mee Siam, Mee Goreng,  Roti John.
There are also Chinese Food - Prawn Noodle Soup, Friend Prawn Noodle, Chicken Rice, Duck Rice, Fishball Noodle, Fried Kway Teow, Friend Carrot Cake and Friend Oyster.
Home to many many good food stalls, both halal and non halal.  Nasi lemak, Indian rojak, mee soto, kambing soup, prawn noodles etc

It's been my favorite hawker centre for the past 40 years! Renowned for it's wide array of Malay and Indian Muslim food.

Must trys:
Selera Nasi Lemak, Mutton Soup (Indian), any of the 'goreng' stalls (mee goreng, bee hoon goreng, nasi goreng, etc.), Indian Rojak, satay, Malay Style Chicken Rice, Briyani, Adam Road Mee Rebus stall, Adam Road Prawn Mee, Adam Road Duck Rice and any of the indian-muslim coffee stalls.
Wow... Feels so nice after pandemic when you visit such a lively place. Tried the Indian Rojak, was super nice. Next time for the Nasi lemak with 20m queue hehe

Open food court with everything in Singapore you would want to try. From Satay and Nasi Padand and 2 famous Nasi Lemak stalls with queues all day long but gone by 5pm.

All of Chinese and Indian cooking. And fruit juices at $2 for anything, cut fruit and ice desertts. So many drink shops with "teh tarik" and all kind snacks.

Hugeparking space but still streets nearby full parking usually no space at all meal times with parking warriors mercilessly issuing summons 24/7.

Just accross the two street Bukit Timah and Dunearn Road is botanical gardens, next to Cold Storage. Really a scenic corner of greenery such that Adam Roads Food Centre toilets are designed in open green trees concept. Pay 10 cents to old man for clean upkeep and toilet paper and soap.

It is great space for afternoon tea into dinner. Not much beer drinkers as crowds wait to take over departing diners. Spend a day after walking in the trails of world famous botanical gardens.
Great local place. Food is delicious and so inexpensive.  Love how there are many different ethnic cuisines here all in one place.
It has one of the best dessert stall in Singapore. Also love the nasi lemak, fishball meepok stall and prawn noodle stall.

This hawker stall is visible across the street from Botanic Gardens Station via the overpass or crossing. In Korea, it's like a local food court.

I ordered the small fried oyster at No. 22, the chicken rice set (roasted and steamed half and half, with extra meat) at No. 23, and the Power Avocado at No. 29.

The fried oyster, unlike what you'd find in Korea, was a stir-fried oyster, egg, and meat dish. It's delicious dipped in sauce and should be eaten while it's still hot. It's even better when mixed with the rice that came with the chicken rice.

The chicken rice set was delicious with the owner's homemade chili sauce. The chicken was tender and flavorful, and the bones were removed, making it easy to eat. The broth tasted like chicken broth you'd get at a milmyeon restaurant, and the bok choy was also good. Above all, the owner was cheerful and friendly. The spicy Sri Cha Cha egg stir-fry, which wasn't on the menu, was especially delicious, but it's a shame they don't sell it. It's difficult to grind and grind the sauce myself, so it's hard to offer it on the menu. The food is delicious, so I highly recommend it!

The Power Avocado is served shaved ice, filling and delicious. This place is famous for their Avocado + Banana Mix (No. 2), but I couldn't eat it that day because they didn't have any bananas.

Aside from that, Rojak (No. 19) has its own distinct flavor profile, but I found it quite enjoyable. The peanuts, sauce, and other ingredients all contributed to the flavors. I enjoyed the pineapple and cucumber inside, but the wheat bread didn't quite suit me. I think it's because the texture was a bit dry. Still, it's worth it.

Finally, the ginger milk tea was delicious and warm.

There are more locals than tourists here, and there are also police officers and high school students, so I guess that's why the prices are relatively affordable and the food is delicious. After ordering and paying, you can pick up your food when it's your turn. After you're done, you can return it to the non-hala (tray) in the center. A separate staff member will clear your table. It's an open space with fans, so it can be a bit hot, but it's a fun place to enjoy a local atmosphere. Parking is available, and the place is clean. There are also clean restrooms. Please note that the entire restaurant may be closed on certain days for food preparation or cleaning.

*2025.7.31.

The food was good, the tables were clean. The place is not air-conditioned, but there are many fans, which definitely help in the humid and hot Singaporean weather. As I tucked into this Mee Rebus with extras for my occasional cheat day craving this brings back memories of familiar starter morning kick off to a work day during my madmen days. The one that got a late old friend all excited not realising that this gem is actually just around the corner from his place when he popped back home. Alas he's no longer here but with each bite a piece of the many memories we shared is rekindled ü§≤üèª‚òùüèª

A lot has changed at this food centre. The long queues for the two famous nasi lemak are no longer so evident. The first with the relatively unfriendly makcik stayed the same but the overhyped one that spawned Crave sadly allowed commercialism to spiral their own brand of nasi lemak into expensive blahness. Notably the (in)famous headband auntie with her stupendous famous Mee Soto with the delicious soup is long gone with her. We started not having friendly interaction for she was garang and uncommunicative but we ended up exchanging good tidings when my wife and I bid her well as she battled cancer when we met her in a wheelchair. She left not only with her quietly supportive kind husband who also passed but along with their memorable signature Mee Soto which I used to have with chicken feet and gizzard with the kick of her special chilli sauce.

Luckily this old skool style thick gravy Mee Rebus is continued by the friendly and sweet adik helper taking over from the Pak Haji who used to tend to the stall.

So with each bite I'm allowing the flood of memories to just bring back to the good old times here.

This Hawker is close to Botanical Garden. Foods are cheap for only $4-6 and yummy. Some accepts Online payment, some just cash!

They have wall fans all over so very comfortable to eat.

Food across all stores were affordably priced, at S$4 & up for various local cuisines. However, the tastes of the food were average and made for just a stomach-filler.

Finally came here again after soon long! The was no crowd during early dinner timing abd we ordered from a few stalls for sharing.

The satay stand out among all the food and we highly recomend üëçüèªüëçüèªüëçüèª

The place is relatively narrow but very crowded. Sometimes we need to line up for 10-20 mins.  I recommend you to try the prawn noodles and nasi lemak here. Also, this food court got some stall sell smoothies, healthy, cheap and taste good.

Late night and feeling hungry....this is the place to visit. Friday and Saturday nights are crowded. Good selection of Muslim and Indian food. Famous nasi lemak during the day. Kambing soup, mee goreng and satay at night.  Recommended!

The Ching Tng from the dessert stall is delicious and full of ingredients.  Adam road noo ching prawn noodles had a flavorful broth, suggest to have the meal at evening hours because the stall holder has 2 shifts and the evening shift's soup base were cooked with better ingredients. As part of the staff walk this month, our team took a walk through the Botanical Gardens and ended to the north near the Adam Food Centre. Decided to go for the Mee Soto and Mee Rebus stall to order a regular mee soto soup with chicken meat slices and noodles. We are not disappointed as the soup was savoury, rich in spices, dark in favour with their own blend of chilli. Finished off the meal with sugar cane juice with lemon, a good respite from the warm weather as most of us were sweating buckets after the walk. This time around, I did not go for the Adam Road Nasi Lemak, nor the Adam Chicken rice as it was not opened. Will come back to try any other time!

Haven't been here for ages.  Tried the Indian Rojak, still good.  The dessert stall that sells local desserts were great. Highly recommend.  Their tau swan is not too sweet yet very fragrant.  Had bbq stingray with sambal was also good.

Kembing soup was tasty. Not much meat for a $10 serving.

Enjoyed looking at the 2 hens with their 6 chicks, at the lawn behind the food centre.

I went here for lunch before going to the Botanical Garden. It is only walking distance from the park. One of the famous meals here is nasi lemak. There was a long queue in front of the food stall during lunch. The food in this place is affordable. Both halal and non halal food are available here. Many employees in nearby offices apparently eat here for lunch. I could see a glimpse of local life here.

Do give all the stalls a try. I would say none are bad!

My coworker took me to the Adam food centre for nasi lemak. This Hawker centre caters to a more local crowd and gets really crowded during lunch time.

I had the nasi lemak from Selena Rasa Nasi Lemak. They make everything to order so the line will move pretty slow.  I ordered the royal flush which comes out to a little over 5 Sing dollars.

The fried chicken is crispy and juicy and my favorite part of the plate. The rice is fragrant and aromatic. I didn‚Äôt care so much for the paste component in the banana leaf.  Additionally, I would have my egg cooked over easy and not have a fully cooked yolk. Overall, the dish was tasty but wouldn‚Äôt want to wait in line for 30 minutes again.

It's not crowded if you feel like having the famous Adam road nasi lemak and delicious fishball noodle at 8am in the morning.  Be warned that the cleaners will insist that you return your plates and trays to the designated point after you finished your food. Wish more stores are open.

Conveniently located opposite the Singapore Botanic Gardens and Botanic Gardens MRT station, the food centre is suitable for tourists looking for lunch or dinner. Indian Muslim food is rightfully popular with strengths in flavour and variety.

Yummy food at this hawker center: indian, Chinese and Singaporean food. Water basins available to wash hands, but I didn't see a washroom. It's a smaller hawker center, maybe around 30 stalls.
