Nice hawker center, one of the most famous stalls is mutton stall, great soups there! Chicken rice is nice as well.

Most people come here for the nasi lemak, prawn noodles, mutton soup and at night the BBQ seafood are good.

Recently there's a new added chicken rice store call Tong Fong Fatt. The chicken rice here is actually very good. Both the fried chicken and boiled chicken are good. Personally prefer the boiled version but my family prefer the fried version. We like it so much that we always buy a  whole chicken.
Lots of notoriously Good Foods now operated by 2nd generation stall holders. Nasi Lamak, Pratas, Ayer Bandung... favourite with night owls.

My favourite hawker centre since the early 1990ies.

Delicious local food üòã and definitely a must to try the fresh fruit juices of Steward Fryit Juice. The taste is great with a huge selection of juices.
Great place for a meal anytime of the day. Wide selection of Malay dishes ..... From nasi lemak, mee soto, mee rebus, nasi goreng, chicken rice etc.

A must-go if you're on the Coast-to-Coast trail. Was there on a Sunday afternoon and it was very crowded. Due to social distancing measures, there aren't many tables at a time.

There were long queues at the popular nasi lemak, prawn noodles and dessert stalls. My friend queued for the nasi lemak for about 30 mins.

Thankfully, the crowd thinned when it rained heavily. Managed to try the ais kacang at the dessert stall, and it was good! The shaved ice was soft, ingredients aplenty and delicious. The lady taking orders was friendly and would remember your table if they took your order in advance for desserts still in preparation.

The boneless chicken rice was not bad, but quite expensive for the portion of chicken.

Minus one star for this food centre due to the crowd. Probably best to takeaway instead of dining in.
The food centre has quite limited stalls. Avocado chocolate shake is not bad, quite thick. Duck rice is nice but beware of the tofu. It turned sour (spolit).

Quality of food has dropped a little since I was last there more than 20 years ago. But, the nice part is that it is CLEAN. Everything including the restrooms are clean. Way, way, way above normal Singapore hawker center clean.

Some ventilation issue here. Avoid if you cannot deal with it. Otherwise awesome food here. Must try the taosuan. People typically come here for the Nasi Lemak and other Muslim food. The prawn noodles is good too!
It's been quite a while since I came here for food. Prices r kept low affordable! Roti prata still at $1/= a piece. Milk tea at $1/= :) Packed 2 famous Adam Rd Nasi Lemak for lunch.

The food court offers almost exclusively Indian /Muslim food. The mutton soup is recommended by many and it's opening for dinner and supper. I ordered the must try mutton leg but it's rather mutton tendon (so order mutton meat/ mutton rib if u prefer meat than tendon). The soup is really tasty. $6/9 per bowl
On a Sunday morning 2-3 shops open to cater to any halal nasi lemak craving...4sgd for the basic.
We tried prawn noodle at Big Prawn noodle stall and kway teow soup of Siti Nur stall, they were quite ok!

Bahrakath Mutton Soup King
Opening Hours: Open 1pm to 3am daily
Soup with bread, yummy yummy, match!

Favorite place for lunch  after long walking along Botanical Garden,i like the Satay here,worth it!

4 stars because less seats and tiring to waiting next seat as most costumers here seems enjoying their meals & take time to move üòÇ(specially on weekends/lunch time)
Crowded place. Difficult to find car park if you are driving. Nice food. Go for fried oyster, chicken rice, prawn noodles. I haven‚Äôt tried the rest yet.
Alot of stalls closed.  Not sure if was due to a Tuesday or times have changed for the food center.
One of my favourite hawker centre in Singapore. Couple of dishes that you will have to try when here: mutton soup and the fried beehoon with pork (Áå™ËÑöÁ±≥Á≤âÔºâ.

Adam Road Food Centre will always have a place in my heart as long as I live. My old Whitley Secondary School was just a 15 min away and my all time favourite has and will always be the Indian Rojak. I will also recommend the mee rebus and mee Soto and Kambing soup too. Nasi lemak is individual so u choose where the Q is. The fruit stall is also good with selection of fruits and it's juices. Awesome choice of hot and cold drinks to relinquish with your food.. parking can be tough during peak hours.

TEH HALIYAH MEETS CARROT CAKE

Adam‚Äôs food centre is home to many famous stalls in the island. Well known for Nasi Lemak, Indian Rojak and Mutton Soup, it is a relatively small food centre with a semi open-air, Hexagonal arrangement right beside the Adam‚Äôs flyover.

The Hawker centre is emotionally attached to me since my first visit in 2014. Whenever I step into this area, along with nostalgia, I look for two items: a bottle of chilled beer from aunty‚Äôs stall and a $5 dark (Singaporean) Carrot Cake with chilli. I am surprised that not many people have mentioned the stall in their super list of Chai Tow Kway, but if I were to make one, this stall would top the list. But the two are closely followed by Teh Haliyah served by the Ronaldinho look-alike Malaysian Indian hawker. This time, I chose the ginger tea over Beer, simply to try a new combination.

We rarely get a proper visual access to the wok where the chopstick licking Carrot Cake gets done. But the orders are taken with all possible customizations. After a short wait, you could claim your piping hot carrot cake served in a leaf shaped green plate. I strongly recommend that you take no additives like chilli or sauce, but grab a plastic spoon to scrape out the tastiest final remains of sauce from the plate.

On the other side, it make no sense to watch Ronaldinho making Teh Haliyah. It happens in a time shorter than your brain would take process it. He quickly fills the Teh glass with black tea and strong ginger water and then performs a ‚Äúscoop - throw‚Äù trick to transfer condensed milk from tin to glass. At this stage, most of the tea makers just give it a quick stir and serve. This guy adds tarik (a pull technique) to it to give you a 007 level ‚ÄúShaken, not stirred‚Äù mix.

The ingredients in the two dishes complement each other perfectly that makes one  plug into nirvana. Fried garlic in the carrot cake combines with the ginger water to strike  the roots of our taste buds while caramelized sugar neutralises the bitter tea to add a new flavour to the milk. Its less likely that you won‚Äôt slurp the carrot cake and finish off the tea in minutes. And beware, you may feel warm and even sweat after the treat. So it is better to sit under the fan for a while, before you decide to leave.

Haven't been here for decades decided to visit this afternoon. The place is buzzing with lots of muslim and Chinese stores, and lots of customers. Tried the fried carrot cake and malay chicken soup. Both didn't disappoint. I remember many other good stalls too(from my dunearn hostel days)
This is definitely an overlooked hawker centre( by tourists). Can rival Newton Centre, Tiong Bahru, and other more famous ones in quality.
A must for hawker foodie.

Lots of halal food in here. The most recommended stall here is the famous "Selera Rasa Nasi Lemak". Try the Royal Rumble menu, the most complete choice of nasi lemak with its sides: fried chicken, fried fish, fried egg, otah (kinda fish cake with asian spices), and potato perkedel (mashed potato batter with egg and fried). The trivia is: President of Indonesia, Joko Widodo and the sultan of Brunei loves this dish so much that they had this as breakfast when they visit Singapore.

Not very crowded even on a saturday.

Food waz great, recommend the prawn noodle soup.
Prawn  noodle is good, especially the dry version.
5 minutes walk away from Botanic Garden. It is famous for Nasi Lemak.
Heritage of hawker center in Singapore. If you don‚Äôt mind walking, then recommend to try. MRT Station botanical garden
Small but friendly and good place for quick breakfast. Nasi lamak is traditional style. Walking distance from Botanic garden.
had a ‚Äúteam dinner‚Äù here! didnt expect the place to be quite packed, but it was my first time so i dont know what types of food are famous here üòÇ ‚Ä¶

One of the old time hawker centre that has been around even before my childhood days. It is famous for its spread of delicious Halal food stores.
Very very crowded during lunch and dinner hours with super long queues at the famous stores. And can get quite warm in the day time.
Place is small but lots of good food option. Carpark next to it is small too, parking is quite limited.
Pretty average food center serving mostly nasi lemak.  There is not enough variety food stalls and the taste of most of the stalls are just average
Good food but prices are slowly but surely creeping up
Nice place to come for the Muslim food. Parking is very challenging.
The one and only fishball noodles stall is excellent in terms of food quality & customer service as both the husband & wife team are very friendly & can remember regular customers by names.
Always come here for the Adam's chicken rice. But choose the ayam penyet, the sambal is the best. But always sold out very fast. Must come early.
Good food but half of the shops are closed at night
Food is fantastic of course. However prices are much to be desired. More expensive than your average hawker center.

Quite a number of stalls was closed when I went.

Saw there was Rojak, ordered it. Portion was abit small for $4 but inflation I guess.

Went on to ordered bee join goreng ikan bilis. Not bad.

I think go for lunch for more options
The hawker centre is not big, and partial stalls are opened at night, the environment is OK.

After renovation, it's brighter and slightly airier. But the heat and humidity hasn't been fully taken care of despite the fans. Airflow should have been seriously considered during renovation... Food at some stalls is pricier than other food centres, comparable to Newton Circus. But generally, service is better than most other food centres in Singapore!

Adam Road Food Centre is a hawker gem!

The hawker center has a great laid-back atmosphere too. Be prepared to look around for an empty table as it gets quite busy, but the delicious food is well worth it.

I highly recommend making a trip to Adam Road Food Centre, especially for the Sam Lo Hor Fun if you love Chinese hawker fare. Will definitely be back to try more.
Delicious üòã yummy food
The place is so much better after their recent major renovations.  Much more airy and well ventilated.  Plus the tables are a bit bigger too. Food wise still the same shops.   Best Indian rojak here
Fried Hokien Mee is our family favourite here. The chef is nice & friendly. Food always served so quickly & tastes great. His radish cakes & oyster omelette are pretty good too.

First time to try spare-ribs prawn soup noodles. The soup & spare-ribs were delicious. The prawns were fine. Don't order thick bee Hoon because they don't cook long enough so it tasted pretty raw & rough. I'll go for it again, but may choose kway teow next time. Queue may be long but they are fast workers. A bit pricey though.
Lots of people during morning hours. Food is good and lots of choice. Price is great !

This hawker center has been a favorite since my school days, featuring a diverse range of food stalls ideal for late-night suppers. I appreciate the longstanding stalls that remain and the overall cleanliness, though additional parking options would be beneficial.

Hong Lim Market & Food Centre is a culinary treasure trove that lives up to its stellar reputation. Nestled in a bustling locale, this hawker centre is home to 4 or 5 Michelin-recommended stalls, each offering a unique insight into the richness of local flavors. The energy of the place is palpable‚Äîalways packed with locals and food enthusiasts alike, eager to experience authentic, top-tier street eats.

One of the biggest draws is the variety of food on offer. Every stall has its own specialty, ranging from meticulously crafted noodles and savory seafood dishes to irresistible satays and innovative twists on traditional recipes. Each Michelin-recommended vendor brings passion and expertise to their craft, ensuring that every bite is a memorable adventure in taste. The quality is consistently high, often rivaling that of more upscale dining establishments, yet served in a refreshingly unpretentious atmosphere.

One of the best hawker centre around. Packed with about 100 stalls - many run by veteran hawkers with decades of experience. Some stalls are even Michelin-listed.

One can find a huge variety of local favourite dishes here - from smoky wok hei noodles & rich curry chicken bee hoon, to bak chor mee, Hokkien mee & even traditional desserts. Prices are fair & portions generous. Expect long queues at popular stalls, especially during the lunch rush (12 - 1:30‚ÄØPM).

Seating can get a little tight & warm during peak hours, but the atmosphere is vibrant & authentically local. A must-visit for anyone wanting to experience real Singapore hawker culture.

If you‚Äôre chasing the ultimate plate of fried kway teow in Singapore, this legendary stall at Hong Lim Market & Food Centre is my top pick. Every visit feels like a reunion with comfort food done right.

The ‚Äúwok hei‚Äù here is unmistakable‚Äîsmoky, intense, and deeply satisfying. And that signature pork lard smile? It‚Äôs not just a garnish, it‚Äôs a promise. Crispy, golden bits that elevate every bite with rich, indulgent flavor.

The uncle behind the wok is a master of his craft. He‚Äôs meticulous with every plate‚Äîbalancing sauces, controlling heat, and portioning ingredients with care. You can see the seriousness in his movements, and taste it in the results. Occasionally, a younger assistant takes over when the uncle‚Äôs on break. While the finesse may vary slightly, the taste still holds up well and is worth trying.

Be prepared to wait, especially during lunch rush. But honestly? The queue is part of the experience. It builds the anticipation‚Äîand the reward is always worth it.

This stall consistently satisfies my cravings. It‚Äôs a stall that respects tradition, delivers bold flavors, and never compromises on quality. Whether you‚Äôre a local or just visiting, this is one plate you shouldn‚Äôt miss.
Always love this hawker. Tourist spot so apparently price is a bit higher. This famous noodles cost me 7 sgd for small portion. Half boiled eggs are brought from coffee stall.
Iconic Chinatown hawker. First tasted sg chicken curry mee and traditional breakfast set here. Great spot for that authentic local makan vibe :)
The best place for breakfast in Sg. Its a food complex that you can come here over and over again for different stall‚Äôs great food.
BEST hawker centre! Nearby Chinatown, Heng kee chicken curry noodle soup is just awesome! Morning bakut teh is also delicious, meaty rib! Will come back again for sure, 1000%!

Please support the VI stall at level 2 which sells $2.8 economic rice! The food tastes nice and homely. Uncle give a very decent portion of food despite the inflation. I love that the owner is keeping the cost low as long as he could for low income elderly. He‚Äôs even featured on 8days.
Wow we were staying at the Mercure icon hotel and were looking for an ATM. Happened on this little know Hawker centre. Got this number 11 from Yong Tau Foo Lady for breakfast. 6.50 Singapore dollars

Ji Ji Wanton Noodles is by far the best wanton noodles I‚Äôve tried. The taste is always up to standards, and the generous ingredients make it a must-try. Just be prepared to wait in line, as it‚Äôs always quite long.

I like coming here! Jian Wei and the team are always so friendly and welcoming. They really make you feel at home. What impresses me most is that they remember exactly how I like my coffee, which adds such a personal touch. Even when it‚Äôs busy, they keep things running smoothly and never compromise on service. The food is consistently delicious too, fresh, flavorful, and satisfying. Highly recommend this spot for anyone looking for great coffee, good food.

found this place via Google and loved the interesting setup. the staff were all smiles and friendly. easy to order via qr code. food is decent except the bacon from the big breakfast was too salty. but the presentation was nicely done.

The Ritual is a wonderful spot for brunch, with comfortable and clean setting with plenty of space. The staff are attentive and quick to accommodate my needs. While the prices are slightly on the higher side, the quality of the food and service reflects the value.

We ordered several dishes. The truffle eggs croissant was nice, with perfectly fluffy scrambled eggs enhanced by the rich aroma of truffle, all nestled in a buttery, flaky croissant. It was flavorful and satisfying.

The rosti with sausage is my favorite. The potatoes were shredded finely and pan-fried to golden, crispy perfection. Smoked salmon was included at no extra cost and the sausage (+$2) added a hearty and savory touch to the dish.

For dessert, the waffle with strawberries and vanilla ice cream stood out. The waffle was light yet crispy, with a generous portion of strawberries that added a tangy balance to the creamy vanilla ice cream. It was a sweet and satisfying end to the meal.

It‚Äôs a lovely place to enjoy a meal when you‚Äôre looking to treat yourself.

At Ritual cafe along Bukit Timah road.

All the food we ordered was delicious üòã. The rose honey cold brew was yummy.

Can come again.

Please keep us the good work guys.

The big breakfast lived up to its name with the portion size! Was wonderfully prepared so it thought that it was the most worth it, given the price point of the food here.

The fries were a good side dish and the bulgogi chicken rice had a really interesting sauce and the egg was cooked wonderfully.

The peach fizzy drink was nice and refreshing but the iced matcha (didn‚Äôt get a picture) was a bit too milky and didn‚Äôt have the kick.

If you are here during a peak period might need to wait a while as there were quite a number of people working in the place, good place to study and do work I guess!

Came on a Tuesday at 5PM just for Waffles.
Was sad that ‚Äúwaffle batter finish already‚Äù. Staff didnt offer to make the waffle batter again.

Ate a chocolate muffin. Unevenly warmed, warm on outside cold on inside.

Will give them one more chance in the next week or so. Hope they have waffles then.

‚Äî-
Came back again, they did have waffles. Fresh and of the right crisp. The berries a bit too strong but the chocolate gelato was lovely,

Service staff were friendly and helpful.

Would recommend!

A cool cafe if you need to get some work done. Food was good but pricey (what you get in Singapore). Free WiFi and generally comfortable space. However there is not much natural lighting, only 1 window which is the main door. QR code service.

The place is so nice and the breakfast is very delicious i tried avocado toast and truffle egg croissant i rate it 10/10 üëåüëå ‚Ä¶.staff are kind and friendly ‚Ä¶..absolutely gonna visit it again üëç
Food was delicious! The Truffle Mushroom Pasta was rich in flavor but the portion was too much to our liking. Love the service and would definitely come back again. ü§ç

Price is on a pricier side but the flavours are really unique. They offer options different from the typical cafes and I‚Äôm here for it.

Loved the curry mango chicken sandwich. And their truffle kombu fries. The rose honey tea is amazing, can be less sweet.

I think it‚Äôs worthwhile for them to explore pure kombu fries without the truffle flavour. It did overpower the kombu taste.

Service is great and we were able to get a seat at around 2.30PM

Lovely place to have brunch at or if you‚Äôre (like me) hiking from Bukit Timah Hill and through the railway corridor and looking to refuel on a Sunday afternoon.

I ordered the Somen with ikura and scallop. The scallop was done nicely and still had the flavours of the ocean and just the right amount of char. I thought it was really good. It was a simple and light lunch which was perfect for what I was looking for.

Will be back.

Hot matcha latte sgd6 was very creamy and nicely sweetened! Loved it. Latte was strong and creamy.

Avocado toast sgd19 had lots of avomash, great taste, sour dough bread was crispy without being too tough to eat, slightly pricey for a single serving of toast. Sous vide egg could have been slightly less watery. Served with pomegranate seeds which aren't a favourite of mine but passable and interesting. Ritual breakfast scrambled eggs was a bit too salty, great texture though.

Place doesn't get too noisy, plenty of light and nice high ceiling. Service was reasonably attentive. Minimalistic decor. Great place to chill with family, friends, or just alone. Walkable to Stevens MRT.
Delicious balance of sweet and savory items. Their truffle mushroom pasta is excellent.

Went there for a business meeting and ordered a dessert and a lemonade.

Though have a reservation but couldn't find a conducive seating. Have to give to the staff for being extremely friendly, attentive and helpful. He cleared a table and got me a good place at the corner for my purpose.

The chocolate croissant and lemonade were on point.

Definitely will be back as the place was great for coffee and tea but have to say it was too noisy for quiet work. But excellent for business meeting.

We were surprised to see the place being quite crowded when we reached around 10am on Sunday. Driving there was a challenge as parking was within a service apt which was out of our expectation.

Food was very nice, although expensive. Waffle cost $15 each but very worth our calories. It was moist inside and crispy outside. It felt light and not taste all flour. We tried their new ah boy laksa gen Z style. Also quite nice although the sauce tasted more like chilli crab than laksa.

This is an excellent place for Koenig coffee and the croissants are OUT OF THIS WORLD!!! They are the lightest, flakiest, and most delicious I've had in Singapore! The almond croissant was PACKED with almond paste; no skimping there! It's bright, clean, and relaxing. Two thumbs up.

The food was amazing! Truffle fries were super flavourful. The signature avo toast was different from most out there. There‚Äôs a taste to the avocado, not just your typical plain avocado. I love waffles with salmon personally. The waffles was perfect for brunch moments and increase the business owner kind o brunch vibes. Atmosphere was so chill for a Saturday afternoon. Haven‚Äôt been in a cafe on a Saturday afternoon in a long time and this vibes is perfect to spend time to catch up with family and friends after a super exhausting work week.
Totally recommend to chill out and hang.

Overall had a good experience at this cafe. Lunch time can be crowded, the cafe doesn't really mind people hogging the table as I can see students and working adults ordering just a cup of coffee while working on their laptops. Booking is highly recommended. Food quality is on the very satisfactory side. From the way it is cooked, the taste and presentation gives me the idea that the owner of the place had paid attention to satisfy the customers. Coffee was on point too.

I only had 1 cafe latte here while chilling with my 2yo for an hour or 2,but I found everything excellent. First of all, the latte was pretty awesome - strong but not overly bitter or burnt, milky but not insipid, with a rich flavour. I didn't have anything else, but the menu was quite varied with all kinds of brunch food.

Next, let's talk about the ambience. It was very bright and airy on a weekend morning, , with various types of set ups. You like normal table and chairs? You can sit on those. You like counter type seats? They have you sorted out too. Bar stools and tables? Yup, they have those? Sofa seats? Scoot right in. You have kids? High chairs, children's cutlery and even children's books are available to save the helpless parent. Best of all, power plugs are also pretty much everywhere, so feel free to use your laptop over food and drinks to get some work in.

Lastly, while service wasn't particularly exceptional, I got everything I needed without being intruded upon, as all kinds of utensils and necessities are available right at the counter, and everyone was chill about my toddler walking and climbing and blabbering throughout my patronage.

Would definitely go again if I'm in the area.

A neighbourhood gem in Bukit Timah. Excellent coffee. Delicious dishes made from quality ingredients. Decent service.
The decor is simple. Noticed some crumbs on the floor, but overall good ambiance.
Protein bowl and the truffle scrambled eggs were delicious.

‚úÖ Friendly, helpful & prompt service by the staff üëè
‚úÖ Very tasty waffle (crispy on the outside and soft on the inside) and the waffle has a hint of sweetness but not too much. Paired with strawberries and light drizzles maple syrup making it the perfect afternoon treat üòÅ
‚úÖ Their long black is nice too
‚úÖ I also like their web-based ordering and payment system so I can DIY the ordering & closing of the bill expediting the service and leaving the staff to focus on serving.

Overall it was definitely a 5‚≠êÔ∏è experience for me and will definitely visit this cafe again when I‚Äôm in SG.

Everything we ordered here was good; ordered crab meat aglio olio, truffle mushroom pasta, waffle with ice cream and iced latte. Truffle mushroom pasta is creamy but not gelat, with medley of fresh mushrooms; latte is smooth. One of the best ice cream waffles I've tried: crispy waffle with good vanilla ice cream and dark choc sauce isn't too sweet.

Staff are very friendly and patient, vibes üíØ family and work friendly place as well. Higher price point but quality food and service, highly recommend !!

A rather cozy cafe to start the day energetically. Lots of sunlight and warmth from the interior.

Food was good. We had:
The ritual big breakfast
Avo toast
Truffle smoked salmon toast

Food is of good quality and taste is fresh!
I enjoyed the avocados a lot!

thoroughly enjoyed the experience here, really work friendly and nice atmosphere & interior. food is slightly pricier but worth it for the productivity! particularly love their truffle scrambled egg sourdough with smoked salmon. portion size is generous and filling. also recommend the butter "chicken" cauliflower rice, a super keto and vegetarian friendly dish! dessert wise, i enjoyed the scone a lot!!! their soymilk latte was really nice too, with a very creamy and smooth soy taste unlike some other places with a bit of grainy aftertaste.

I've been here for a couple of times now and just tried their new seasonal menu. I ordered the entr√©e, A Barramundi's Voyage, and the dessert, Sweet Dreams Made In Thai.

A Barramundi's Voyage has great taste with the spicy coconut broth. Tangy and savory with a hint of spiciness make the dish not feel as 'heavy' as it seems. The portion was fairly good. The protein was not dry or tough. I'm not really a fan of fish, but this dish has proved to me that fish can be as good as beef! :)

The mushrooms and potato leaves, together with the fish and broth, make a great combination of texture and flavor in your mouth. Honestly, I wished the dish was endless.

The dessert, Sweet Dreams Made In Thai, has a strong tropical flavor with bits of chopped mangoes on top. There was a slight citrus taste to the mango mousse, which made it really refreshing and light.

The mango mousse may have overpowered the taste of the coconut cream, but nonetheless, the cream together with the mousse was great. The cake was surprisingly not dry as it was sandwiched between the mousse. On top of that, the brown rice puff enhanced the overall texture and feel of the dessert.

Was really glad that I tried it and will definitely recommend this seasonal menu to anyone's visiting!

Went there with wife and 10yo. Ordered big breakfast and beef with eggs. Overall the food and drinks were good except that the beef was slightly tough.

Highly recommended cafe with great ambience and free 1 hour parking within the building.

absolutely LOVED this cafe; great environment for work/ study, full wifi and complimentary lemon water and there are plugs hidden by pillows for the seat at the back! they don‚Äôt offer the baked potatoes anymore, got the mango chicken sando and it was a very generous portion, recommend for sharing. the staff are super friendly too :)

I brought my family here to celebrate a birthday and everyone was so happy with Ritual!

The Truffle Kombu fries, Truffle Mushroom Pasta, Smoked Salmon Scrambled Egg Toast, coffee (Latte, Capuccino, Black Coffee), Waffle with Salted Caramel & Banana were all very nice. I also tried their crabmeat alio olio on a separate occasion and it was nice! Just remember to ask for less spicy if you can't take spicy.

What's good is that they have a wide range of food with western and Asian options. My mum ordered the Grandma Lee's congee and it was really good as well!

These were ok: steak and eggs, beef bowl rice - the rice is the short grain sticky type, which some may like, but I prefer rice that's less sticky. Rosti with pork bratwurst - my family said it would have been nicer if it were crispier.

Would definitely come back for more.

I recently had the pleasure of visiting RITUAL, a healthy breakfast and brunch spot near Stevens MRT. I was immediately impressed by the friendly and welcoming staff.

We got a rosti, which was perfectly cooked‚Äînot too oily yet still crispy. The scone was also delicious, with a crispy exterior and a soft, fluffy interior. We paired our meal with a dark chocolate mocha and organic hot cocoa, which were rich and flavorful.

Overall, I had a wonderful experience at the RITUAL. The food was delicious, the service was excellent, and the atmosphere was inviting. I would highly recommend this spot to anyone looking for a healthy and satisfying breakfast or brunch.

Good and fast service. I had the chicken curry mango sandwich: portion was huge and can feed 2 ppl easily. Chicken portion was generous and it was very juicy and the curry gravy tasted amazing. The juice and coffee also taste OK.

Super strong AC, perfect for Singapore heat.

5 stars for turning my prior expectation of portion sizes on its head. Had read a few recent reviews that said the portions here were small‚Ä¶ but just take a look at the size of the katsu curry omu rice (tried using the fork as a comparison) ü§£. Could have easily been shared among 2-3 people!

The curry was made in-house and was tasty and not too salty ‚Äî I was told dark chocolate was one of the ingredients that was meant to add a savoury/slightly bitter aftertaste. The katsu cutlet was very crispy and breaded to perfection. In terms of the drinks, the chai latte could have included more chai.

The cafe was spacious and looked like a part of it was catered towards working folks (abundance of power plugs, free wifi, comfortable seats). We were able to sit there for a few undisturbed hours doing our own things, which I would say made up for the pricier food in return.

Loving this cozy cafe with awesome food and coffee, the vibe and menu offered reminds me so much of Australia and it‚Äôs now a place I patron once a week, be it dine in or take away. Would suggest dining in though, the staff are friendly great place for catch ups, or even a morning coffee. Parking was easy as well, would definitely recommend.

New cozy joint opened at Steven‚Äôs road. Service is great and friendly. Coffee is strong and robust. Try the avocado toast, truffle scrambled eggs and waffles ‚Äî simply amazing!

Free wifi and lots of power sockets around, a great place for meetings and work too.
There is a handsome, friendly, kind and talented chef.

Edit: adding photos from subsequent visits . Still enjoyed food

A nice cafe with very nice deco located just off the stevens MRT station. There‚Äôs a busy McD just beside it and a constant long queue of cars waiting for drive through making this cafe not very obvious. But I finally decided to try it
Their speciality seems to be the avo toast which my friend had, I had the scrambled egg salmon toast which was excellent. Also tried their scone w in-house made jam (also good)
Cafe appears to be laptop friendly as there are a couple of tables with people studying or working on their laptops which is not common for cafes nowadays but it‚Äôs a welcome change.
Overall had a happy lunch

A cafe on Bukit Timah Road, close to Stevens. It has the location advantage as there is no other similar cafe nearby. Very cozy and food is tasty although the price is a bit pricey. Very crowded in the weekend mornings. Better to make the reservation.

I love the service, ambience and simplicity of the arrangement. This place is a bright and cosy environment whilst sipping on your coffee.
Food is excellent with lots of vegetarian and gluten-free options. Avocado toast smacked with flavour and soft, fresh bread, all simply amazing!

Price is also reasonable for the quality of ingredients.

One of my go-to study places! I often come here to get my work done as the atmosphere is very cozy and makes me more productive. There are also multiple charging outlets to charge your devices.

I ordered their Acai Bowl and Madame‚Äôs Truffled Egg Croissant. Their Acai Bowl is topped generously with fresh fruits and nuts and is not overly sweet. The splash of soy milk makes the consistency of the acai smoother. As for their Truffled Egg Croissant: The croissant was buttery and flaky, while the egg was soft and fluffy. The taste of the truffle also did not overpower the dish.

Even though the price is on the more expensive side, I would recommend this place for anyone looking for a conducive environment to get work done and to eat hearty meals.

Love the ambiance of this place. It‚Äôs very peaceful and relaxing. Choices of drinks are very broad. I am not a coffee drinker, so for them to have lots of non-coffee drink options is definitely a plus point for me. I ordered the rose milk tea and i feel that it‚Äôs very nice! (See photo for reference) the only downside is that they put a lot of rose petals into the drink, so you‚Äôd need to chew the petals. However, this place is perfect if you wanna chill and talk with your friends. Also a recommended if you want to just work and have nice drinks and food.
I haven‚Äôt yet to try their main courses, but I‚Äôm definitely looking forward to it‚Äô

Very nice breakfast platter. The pomegranates in the salad are a very nice touch. I don‚Äôt usually like tomatoes, but instead of a whole tomato, theirs was made into a relish, almost like a thick ketchup. Goes really well with everything.

Will definitely come back again for this.

Visited this cafe with my friends during weekend.  The staffs were super friendly and try to accommodate us even though the cafe was full house. The food tastes delicious and serving time was short . I will definitely visit this cafe again.
Was really crowded on weekends morning , worth the wait though

Very nice ambience and great food. The scrambled eggs and toasts were done perfectly, food was a little cold but still quite tasty. Thai spicy wings were great and crispy, and the service staff were very pleasant and polite. They also took special care to set aside the sou vide egg for the beef rice when I told them that my boy had egg allergies. It was the first time I've received such caring service from a cafe. Highly recommended and we are looking forward to going back for more brunch! ‚ò∫Ô∏èüëç

6 of us came here to celebrate my birthday. Our recommendations are: earl grey chocolate tea. Lamb shank, salmon rosti, frangipani berry, burnt cheesecake and earl grey croffle. Cozy ambience, aircon wasn't too strong and sufficient lightings. Service staff were responsive. Carrot cake abit dry, smoked duck abit tough to cut, sandwich could be cut into smaller pieces to be easier to eat, lobster bisque was average. You have to pay at the counter, there is free flow cold drinks. Would come again to try the other dishes and bakery.

just casually finding a cafe to sit and read a book and i must say it was a super pleasant experience:) ordered Oat One Out and the Salmon and scrambled egg waffles to satisfy my sweet and savoury cravings! good cafe to meet up w friends and best to make your reservations! would definite return again

Loved this place, it had such a serene and calming environment. It was so refreshing to see a cafe with an inclusive menu consisting of many vegan and vegetarian friendly options. They also support smaller local products and merchandise here! The staff there were also really friendly and accommodating. Definitely a cafe to look out for !

Love the Grandma Lee‚Äôs Congee they served in the cafe. Simple yet delicious, served with spring onion, fried shallot, diced soy chicken , onsen eggs and dough fritters (Altho bit oily and soggy but overall is delicious, not a common dish you can find in a cafe, pretty heart warming to have a bowl of congee in the early morning).

the RITUAL is a cosy, ambient cafe located smack at Bukit Timah Road. The food options were great, albeit a bit pricey. I got the Big breakfast, while my fiance got the Truffle Scrambled Eggs with Salmon. For drinks, we got the Caffe Latte and Cappuccino. Overall, a good meal after a tiring hike over at Bukit Timah Nature Reserve!

Popped in for the avocado toast... and it was brilliant (thanks to a random review of the place we read when the wife asked for a good avocado toast). I also ordered a Grandma Lee(?) congee (being an old school local who likes his breakfast savoury), and it is definitely a hidden gem that is packed full of protein (chicken breast meat, I reckon) and uber tasty. I might go back alone some morning just for that. Aside from that, it was helpful that they had books and a wire puzzle thingy which helped kept the kid and toddler engaged for a bit (long enough for us to quickly eat before handling the restless toddler again). Will be back again... when the wife has her craving.

The aglio olio is using penne instead of spaghetti but it still taste good! Avocado lovers have to try the smoothie as you can taste very rich of avocado. The staff here all very nice and friendly as well. They informed the dining hour due to busy period later if not I can stay longer which I can understand as well. Cozy place to work with nice wording ‚ÄòAll We Have Is Now‚Äô.

2nd & 3rd Visit:
Brought a dear friend here for brunch and I must say oh boy was I impressed at their portion of food, quality and the ingredients they use! Patronised a few cafes, but the food here at Ritual is really well done! Accompanied with the pretty, cosy interior. Suitable to do work here:) Came at the opening hour, and the cafe isn‚Äôt open, so hope it will be more consistent with what they put on their google page! That aside, happy to give them 5 stars this time!!

1st Visit:
It's a really pretty cafe tucked, just next to Stevens MRT. Happened to just hop in and get some work done, I've a huge thing for interiors, coupled with their LOFI and menu choice of different juices was really happy to come here.

However, when I wanted to stay here longer at 6PM, the cashier did not inform me when I ordered more food then, that it would be the last order or if their cafe was closing soon. I had a very important video call coming in, and wasn't able to move away from my seat, later than to be reminded by the staff I had to leave. I later checked the cafe closes at 6PM, but the staff mention 6.30pm. Felt was an unpleasant experience for me, although also may have caused some inconveniences to the cafe staff. I hope The Ritual's customer service would continue to improve by going the mile to inform customer of its last order so they won't have to rush their food.

besides that I truly like it's ambience, and it's fresh ingredients, and portion, look forward to a better experience next visit!

Brought my son here for a late lunch. We ordered the truffle mushroom pasta, avocado toast, beef bowl, truffle fries and latte. Everything was so good. Portion was just nice and quality of food is good.

Had this cheesecake for the first time and it was phenomenal. I would highly recommend everyone to try it out. The cold brew was so creamy and satisfying. Thanks to my friend who recommended this place.

Order Flat White & Vanilla & Strawberries Waffle for kid.
The waffle is huge and the atmosphere vibe is good.
We visit on last Friday around 2pm, is not crowded. But almost full house.

Sht you not, the best waffles I've had; interior tasted great and it had a lightly crisp exterior. Although, slightly funny that the eggs reminded me of fried rice (it wasn't bad tho). Drinks were pretty okay

Visited this in the first week of December and tried their pre-launch menu. Got the big breakfast, acai bowl and flat white. Coffee was good and the acai bowl is seriously yummy. Sourdough bread that came with the big breakfast did not disappoint. The space is big and airy. I had the seat on the elevated platform and every table had a power plug (but didn't check to see if it was working). The staff were pleasant as well. This place serves beer on tap too, didn't try that though.

Nice work-friendly cafe located at Stevens MRT. Got their ala carte brunch items and the portion size is good. The smashed avocado doesn't really suit my taste buds. The coffee is strong and ok. A good place to chill and work.

Nice and quiet cafe! Visited here a while back during a weekday afternoon and it was packed.

My iced latte looks milkier because I asked for one shot of coffee. Other than the colour difference, it still tasted great. Will come again.

Calming, Homely and Minimalistic Vibes. ‚ú®

Located right outside of town area, it‚Äôs a wonderful place to catch up with friends over a meal.

Didn‚Äôt manage to try their food as we were still full from our lunch. Looking forward to try their all day breakfast the next trip down!!

Excited to see what else this new Cafe will be able to offer!!

Had a wonderful time with my girlfriend. Great ambience and service staff were really attentive too. Really enjoyed their coffee and I had their aglio olio while my girlfriend had their impossible beef burger. Absolutely can't tell the difference with a real beef patty. Really satisfied with my whole experience there. My girlfriend really likes their small book corner, she say it feels really cozy haha. Will come back during weekday to try doing my work there as the space seems conducive.

Love the friendly vibes and selection on the menu.

I really like the coffee here which is 85% arabica and 15% robusta - more heavy bodied and skewed to european taste.
For $6 a latte, it is cheaper than a lot of places in terms of quality and ambience.

I like it that everyone is very hospitable which is really rare in singapore!
Ordered Baked Curry Chicken Mango Sandwich and the portion is big that I couldn't finish the whole thing by myself. The atmosphere of the cafe is so chill and provides charging point as well.
Visited for late lunch and food was pretty good in particular the omurice. They serve good coffee as well. May need to wait to get a table if walking in as they can get busy

Love the ambience and the friendly customer service. The best croissant I had in Singapore and coffee is done really well too.

They have the classic steak and eggs, big breakfast items right now and I was told that they will launch pasta items soon.

Parking is convenient and sheltered under Alocassia Apartments. It is also free in the first hour.

Awesome team, ambience and convenient. Very relaxing place to chill, read a book or do work. There‚Äôs high speed internet and lots of power points.

Food is great with lots of vegetarian and gluten free options. Price is also reasonable for the quality of ingredients.

There‚Äôs parking just right downstairs at Alocassia apartments and it is sheltered all the way. Very convenient for people who drive.

Overall it ticks all the checkbox of an amazing place to have good conversations and time.

Hidden gem in the neighborhood. It's scrunched up between the McDonald and its drive through, but don't let the outside full you.

I had the BEST scrambled eggs in Singapore here. The eggs were well folded with layers. They were fluffy, but not super wet. The chef clearly took her/his time.

The sausage was perfectly cooked and wasn't greasy at all.

The place is very friendly and great with a little kid. They open at 8am in the morning, which was perfect for a morning ride with the kid there. Will definitely be back.
Lovely place. The food and coffee was very good. Avocado toast smacked with flavor and soft fresh bread. Waffles are definite must have. Crispy, Fresh and just the right sweetness. Staff amazing.

I go to gym nearby and pop in for a coffee and food.

They have a great selection of meals like protein bowls and vegan options which is great for people on a fitness program.

I also like their coffee which is less acidic than most coffee places and also cheaper than places like Dempsey and Orchard.

Location is very convenient, being just 2 mins walk from stevens road mrt.

Food was good, particularly love their Chai Latte and their Osmanthus Honey Green Tea- refreshing and eases the throat. The service from the staff is impeccable, immediately attended to me when they saw I am pregnant. Nice cafe to hangout with friends or do some work.

I was here to do some planning for 2023 and the people here were so nice! Gave us the spacious sofa seats and did not chase us out despite us seating here for hours ü•π there was WiFi from McDonald‚Äôs as well as a power socket. Would come back again

The food was surprisingly awesome. We thought at first that it was just all instagramable, but no, it was flavorful. The ambience was very comfy, the kind with good music and then can still make a sincere conversation with someone.

Visited several times now especially when we are in the area. It‚Äôs a convenient walk from Stevens MRT.
Serves great coffee, the last I had it tasted more dark roasted and of earthy tones. Tends to get crowded during lunch times, I visited once on Friday afternoon and they were also bustling! Not to mention the weekends. Crowd is testament to their foods and coffee quality. Crowd here is also interestingly reflective of the demographics of the area.

Delicious! Ate the omu rice and curry chicken mango sandwich, really on point and unique flavors.

Coffee came really hot and stay warm throughout the meal which was nice :)

Definitely coming back!

Frequent the Ritual for breakfast now and then. The oat milk coffee is really nice, and I usually opt for the full breakfast. The scrambled egg is absolutely delicious, and the bacon is really good quality. Ambience is nice, especially early morning [very bright & airy environment]. Lovely ambience, friendly staff and nice food choices.

Prices are similar to most cafes but the experience is way more uplifting and pleasant.

Love to study and chill with friends over coffee and brunch here. There‚Äôs high speed internet and lots of power plugs.

Will recommend friends around the neighbourhood to visit!

Food and drink were great. Service was good as well.
Ordered takeaway on their tiramisu and croffle. üëç
Always good! I‚Äôve been back a few times now and always leave satisfied. Portion size is generous but most importantly the food is delicious.

It' hard to find the balance between indulgence and nutrition when it comes to eating out. the RITUAL has quickly became one of my favourite restaurants in town, because they offer complete guilt-free dishes that are deliciously nutritious. Not to mention the free Wifi, lots of power sockets on every table, it is a great place to "work from home".
Cute cafe with a great atmosphere and good coffee.  There is a good selection of menu and cabinet food.  Recommend the ice black coffee.

Wow, the staff is so friendly, wonderful & helpful whenever u need üòª

Thank you to the warm staff and excellent chef Hayden for the beautiful lunch here at the Ritual. Good APT chicken, salted caramel banana waffles with ice cream and latte! First of many visits here to come! Good vibes as well, two thumbs up üëçüèªüëçüèª
Within walking distance from Stevens MRT, was pleasantly surprised that this cafe was not over crowded on a weekend for lunch. The place is bright and cosy, food and service was superb too.

Finally a nice cafe ard Stevens - cozily tucked at this quaint corner. Drinks and snacks are fantastic, service is good, and good chill vibes all around. Have not tried the mains, but def will be back here either for more coffee runs or catch-ups w friends.
their brownie had a rich chocolate flavour and their cold brew was delicious! i love the nice atmosphere and friendly staff :) it's the perfect caf√© to hang out with friends

Finally I'm here! Am very happieeey after I tried their pastries! Freshly baked everyday and they look gorgeous, taste perfect! Love the cozy space too! Btw, their wifi password is "themomentisnow", so cute isn't?
There have many choices for delicious and yummy pastry. Prefered for the muffin that was superr nice. BesidesÔºåthey sell few types cool brew too. have a nice experience in here.
Lovely place to chill with your friends or have brunch together. Would love to come again and do work or read a book while enjoying the lovely food and atmosphere.

Great sourdough! Love the way they fry it slightly before serving. Creamy buttery taste.

Fries were great too!

Coffee is decent too.

Really enjoyed a lazy weekend brunch here. Staff are very knowledgeable and extremely helpful.

I ate a delicious side serving of scrambled eggs and drank an oat latte. The eggs are some of the best eaten in Singapore! Unfortunately I didn‚Äôt enjoy the oat latte quite as much- the Pacific brand used is very sweet. Much prefer the more commonly used Oatly or Minor Figures brand.

Look forward to getting back again.

First time try. Nice! Food was delicious. I ate the Spicy Chicken Bulgogi Omu Rice. Service was great too. Keep it up!

Food is great and portions are huge. Would totally recommend!

cozy place near stevens mrt! flagged it in my list and was nearby so finally got the chance to go. avocado toast was creamy & the mushy were savoury, though i must say the sourdough was toasted a teeny bit much than i would normally have it, so it was a little tough on the edges. loved it nonetheless:) got peppermint tea as well and the cup is really cute haha! menu is on the slightly pricier end, but I think it's worth paying a visit!

With the birth of many boutique cafes around the island, this cafe made its mark on creating a comfortable yet soothing environment whilst sipping on your drink of choice. Recommend its croissant and small pastries/desserts. Great place to relax with your close grp of friends.

Have been eating at the ritual a couple of times now and every single time the food is always good! This time too! Got the beef bowl and the rice is something special (a little mushy though)

I recently visited The Ritual Cafe and had a fantastic dining experience with my cousin.

Here's a breakdown of the dishes I tried:

Big Breakfast: A hearty, satisfying plate loaded with scrambled eggs, crispy bacon, saut√©ed mushrooms, and toasted bread. The portion was generous, and each component was cooked to perfection.

Truffle Fries: Crispy, flavorful, and indulgent. The truffle oil added a rich, earthy aroma that elevated the dish.

Pasta: I opted for the pasta of the day, which was cooked al dente and tossed in a savory sauce. The flavors were well-balanced, and the portion was generous.

Iced Cafe Latte: A refreshing, well-crafted coffee
Fresh and delicious food, great coffee and lovely atmosphere. A must if you visit Singapore!
Been here few times and always have good experience, nice atmosphere, good food and service, reasonable price.
The portions were big and the food was superb!
Great place, nicely decorated, charming. Able to get some work done. Had the latte and almond croissant, not a food connesiour, but it was quite good. Liked that it opens early at 8am.

üëç brilliant

chanced upon this place and decided to go down!! very aesthetically pleasing layout and chill music, absolutely LOVE the waffles and burnt cheesecake here..will definitely give the mains a go the next time i'm down!!! :)
A newly opened cozy cafe located along Bukit Timah Road. Nice place to unwind and relax before the morning mayhem! It also helps that they have nice coffee and soft fluffy bagel!! Yums üòã ‚Ä¶

Initial meeting a business friend at Mac. Saw this new cafe beside it, so we decided to have coffee at The Ritual Cafe. Very nice latte üòã I will be back here for future business meetings. Nice waffle too.

literally here everyday for the best basque cheesecake and friendliest stuff! coffee is good, service is top tier, pastries are mindblowing, really love this community!

Fabulous food and coffee!! Avocado toast was beautifully presented and delicious; steak and eggs (delicious tender steak perfectly cooked); wonderful bakery and coffee as good as Sydney.

Delicious food and beautiful atmosphere. A new star in the neighbourhood. Be back SOON!

It‚Äôs rare to find a cafe with beautiful ambience and great food that is consistent every time we visit. We love everything that we tried with top faves being the Big Breakfast, Grandma Lee‚Äôs Congee, Madam Truffle Croissant, Baked Curry Mango Sandwich, Cream Cheese Blueberry Muffin & Almond Croissant. Their seasonal menu also never fails to amaze us. Last month‚Äôs Hainanese Pork Cutlet Curry & this month‚Äôs XXL Mala Chicken Bowl both blew our minds. You could feel the love and care behind every dish and that they don‚Äôt skimp on high quality ingredients. Thumbs up to the friendly crew as well. Truly a great place for a weekly winding down ritual.

I had a pleasant time when I went with my sister last Thursday. Healthy food choices and the ambience was really chill. Definitely a quieter cafe out of the other ones I went before. Food is nice. Coffee is excellent. Cosy ambience.

The food is on the higher price range but it is definitely worth it. The wifi is strong and there are charging ports all around. This should be on top of the list for recommended cafes to hunker down in.

Rly surprised this cafe existed in sleepy Stevens otherwise‚Ä¶

Excellent food and coffee. Freshly baked croissant... Bagels... Loved everything except Rosti which tasted a bit funny.

There is a wide variety of menus, from bakery items such as croissants to meal menus such as salads and pasta, so you can choose according to your stomach condition.

The seats are close to each other. Depending on the person sitting next to you, they may talk too loudly and you may not be able to relax. I think the price and quality are just right.

The banana and caramel waffles, homemade gelato, and crispy, freshly baked waffles were a perfect combination. It was delicious. The cafe latte, served in a stylish cup, also allowed me to enjoy the depth of the espresso. The staff were friendly and the service was excellent.

Banana and caramel waffles, homemade gelato, and crispy, freshly baked waffles go great together. It was very delicious. I enjoyed the cafe latte, which was served in a fashionable bowl, and I could feel the depth of espresso. The staff at the shop were very pleasant, and the service was very good. It's a great cafe.

I found this hawker center after looking for halal food in Singapore. It is located pretty far from the airport, but you can quickly go there using MRT. It is located near the Botanic Garden station. Their food selection I think pretty limited particularly because of the limited space. Yes, this hawker center is pretty small for my standard. One of the best delicacies here is the Nasi Lemak. I choose the Selera Rasa Nasi Lemak stall because it highly rated on Google, and also it has long queue of locals. A complete meal cost only SGD 6.00, which pretty affordable for Singaporean standard. It tastes great with rich flavor on the rice and the chicken. Their sambal was not spicy, but rather going to the sweet side. Overall, an enjoyable experience for me.
Had the famous big prawn noodle, it was a good sized prawn for the price. The broth was slightly more savoury for me, but overall, not too bad.

Thought of trying their famous nasi lemak but the queues for the popular stalls were very long, so I ended up going for a stall selling Ayam Penyat, which later I found out was pretty popular stall as well.

I really like good Ayam Penyet and this one was really good. The chicken was crispy and tender and not overly dry just the way I think all Ayam Penyet should be. The chilli was also pretty spicy and I actually couldn't finish all of it. But spicy lovers will definitely enjoy this Ayam Penyet and their chilli!
Many nice food stall. Very good pricing. But parking abit problem....

Not just your average library goers will stumble in Francis A. Gregory Library. Don't be surprised if you see photographers and design snobs there ignoring the books and looking up at the ceiling. The library is famously designed by the same man who crafted the National Museum of African American History and Culture. Somehow we connected the past with the future in his design with lots of wood and glass letting in the natural light.

If you're not a designer or a photographer, here are other reasons to come here:

1) It's clean.

2) Staff are friendly and attentive without being overbearing.

3) They have a large kid section with two play areas.

4) They have private study rooms and conference rooms you can rent for free.

5) There's a playground next door and park.

This library may be the very best in DC!

As one who typically always visited dining options on the "front" side of Nats Park, I had the option to park on the 1st base gate side (back) for a game and was pleased to spy Jackie's immediately next to my parking option!

The decor has images of Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis (Jackie O) in a stylized mural. The outdoor patio is large and offered (new to me!) Two patio options: tables and couches. The tables were served by waitstaff and the couches were "self serve" where you scanned a QR code and then used an app to open a tab and order at will! We opted for the couch option post game to let the traffic clear out and to take advantage of the beautiful evening on the patio.

Loved the self service outdoor couch option! The seats were comfy and outside (a plus) and being able to have everyone run their own tabs with the QR code, chose what they wanted, pay when they wanted was a huge hit! Never had that as a dining option before! Very cool.

I hope to get a peak inside the restaurant soon but the large, comfortable patio was perfect on a breezy but hot DC night after the Nats game.

The food was excellent and the drinks on point.

Will definitely be coming to the "back side" of Nats Park more often!

I was SHOCKED when I came here to leave a review and saw all the negative reviews.  I had such a wonderful and great experience at this location.  I just became an active full-time employee at my current job and I was waiting for all my medical cards to physically arrive in the mail, but desperately needed needed an eye exam because I had run out of contacts and needed an updated prescription.  Elena, I believe is her name, was SO helpful.  She contacted me when she couldn't find my vision insurance and followed up with me thoroughly up until my appointment just to let me know she was still looking into it and she was doing everything she could to make sure they located my insurance.  I took a wrong turn getting off the metro and was late to my appointment, but when I arrived, they were VERY kind and accommodated me.  Every single employee there greeted me, asked how I was doing, and made friendly conversation as I waited for different aspects of my appointment. The optometrist was great and knowledgeable. I received my lenses in the allotted time-frame they gave me and I also got complimentary sunglasses. I have NO CLUE why anyone would have a negative experience here.  It is some of the best customer service I have ever received in a medical office.

OMG...The worst customer service experience ever! Being from the Midwest, I was SO excited to learn that a new Little Caesars was coming to NW DC. Maybe 3 weeks after its grand opening, I paid a visit to this location and I vowed to never return. When 1st entering the store, I was not welcomed by any type of greeting. The girl at the register pretty much stared at me while I was deciding on what to order as if I was holding her up.

When inquiring about the Hot and Ready pizzas, I asked how long the pizzas had been sitting out and she said they had just come out the oven. I also asked about the crazy bread and she said the same thing. So I placed my order, received my food and it was very luke warm. I politely asked her if they could make a fresh pizza and set of breadsticks for me and she said , "These ARE fresh" with the biggest attitude. So we went back and forth a little bit and eventually she asked the cook to make a fresh order, accompanied by an eye roll. When I got my food, it was the sloppiest thing I had ever seen in life.

I then asked her for a refund and she said a manager needed to be there in order for this to happen. I asked her to call the manager if he/she was not there and she claimed they weren't answering the phone. Long story short, I tried calling the store the next day, no response. Then I called district and got a callback right away with refund info and a free pizza offer. I declined the free pizza offer and assured them that I would never return to this particular location again.

This is after waiting 25 minutes for our appointments! i have health insurance but, was denied service if i didn't agree to pay $40! That's like my doctor refusing to examine me if I don't pay a thermo-body scan! The rationale provided to me was that due to an extended length of time between visits due to COVID, the company made it a requirement! That's ludicrous! We only visit once a year anyway so that doesn't make sense! i don't even wear glasses. Why would I pay for a fancy test! Sounds to me like a business just trying to recoup funds during a pandemic. Sooo disappointed! This place is near my home & now I have to find somewhere else. I will also report them because I don't believe it's legal to deny someone with insurance service because they won't pay for an additional & completely unnecessary test!

I write this review as a current member of the City Tavern Club.  I very much have enjoyed my time at CTC so far - I've had the opportunity to meet a diverse, accomplished group of members and received a warm welcome from the membership.  The club offers varied activities, ranging from interesting book talks and lectures to more social events like wine tastings and seasonal parties.  The food and wine selection is fabulous.  The building itself, c. 1796, is extremely well maintained and well-appointed with beautiful furniture and decoration on its seemingly endless floors.  The club is a lovely place to host your next get together or party and can handle events of all sizes and types.  Heather and staff are the stars of the show, creating beautiful events that run the gamut.  I'm thrilled to have found my home away from home in Georgetown.

My friend and I enjoyed the ambience at Dauphine's, but the food was hit or miss. Our meal started off with the bread board, which was a definite hit--the biscuit bites were perfectly flaky and buttery, the sweet potato brioche pillowy, and the baguette the right amount of crustiness and chewiness. As for appetizers, the crudo was very well-seasoned and balanced. The head cheese also had a great depth of flavor without being overly rich. I had to go to the K St location for an early morning scan. The scheduling process was easy and quick, the woman I spoke with on the phone helped me schedule an appointment for 2 days after the Dr's order. She also prepared me over the phone for what would happen during the scan so I felt comfortable coming in. Once I arrived at 745, I went to the wrong office (multiple offices in the building) on the first floor and was directed upstairs by a friendly associate. I was seen only 10 minutes behind schedule, as the office seemed pretty busy for early morning.

The staff who prepped me in office for the exam was wonderful, had great communication skills and put me at ease before the scan. Only had to wait a few minutes between going back and the scan itself. Staff made me feel comfortable, even giving me a blanket during the process. For something that can be nerve wracking, they made the experience as smooth and as comfortable as possible.

Horrible experience thru the mobile app for an after-hours pickup and dropoff, on what is supposed to be a seamless process. The app is extremely clunky and regularly doesn't register your clicks to allow you onto the next page.

You need to submit all kinds of info upon arrival, not before, so prepare for a lengthy delay at pickup time despite the fact that they could've just had you submit everything earlier. Someone on their end needs to verify it in real-time, including calling a friend or family member just to verify that you indeed exist and are renting a truck. Unsure how this is a real security measure but regardless.

Then they gave me the lockbox code to get the truck keys, but the app was so clunky that that page disappeared before I could read it. So I promptly spent the next 20 minutes in the pouring rain on hold with their customer service line, just to get the damn lockbox code. The app thought I'd already started driving, so my only option there was to request roadside assistance (dysfunctional app wouldn't let me submit a request for that either).

Add it all up and you've got a terrible user experience. Find any other truck or equipment rental service whenever possible.

"Not bad."

That's the overall sentiment after dining at Dauphine's.

It's an impressively sized space where you're likely to never feel overwhelmed, by anything.

We started out with signature drinks recommended by the waiter. While they were tasty, and clearly concocted with the right amount of creativity and effort... Neither $14 drink left much of an impression. We also started out with two of their top apps. The blue crab fingers and the peel & eat shrimp. While the shrimp lacked any effort of deveining, I found them to be a decent size and quite tasty with the house cocktail sauce. However, the crab fingers were the biggest disappointment of the night. Not only did the heavy cole-sawish composition taste lack any flavor, the tiny dish also came with a few hard shells sprinkled in the mix.. Which made me take a cautious style of eating.

The entrees were... Good.. You know, not bad. We had the pork belly and steak big plates. Again, both dishes were recommended as two flavorful choices. But neither delivered on that promise.

Having had almost all different types (as far as preparation) of pork belly... I can say without a shadow of a doubt... That was the least enjoyable one I've ever had. It's texture was that of a pork chop and each bite had to be paired with the collard greens for me to even want to finish. But I was starving... So it didn't take much.

The steak was.. Again.. Good, but nothing to write home (or Google) about. I felt that I could have made a better one at home.. With a bit of prep. I/we did like the mashed potato balls that came with it. They were probably the best thing about the entire meal.

Oh... And we did order two more drinks. One red glass of wine (for the steak) and their proudly promoted Sezrac. The Sezrac was good... Actually.. Better than good.. It was memorable.

Overall, I would give this place another shot... But I don't see it being a 'destination.' I give this place a 6.5 (a Not Bad rating)

Seems like there has been some discourse about service, seating, QR codes vs menus. As of April 2021, Jackie is back to as normal of a restaurant experience as you can get. Once at the table, masks can come off, and physical menus are provided (food and drinks). We actually didn't have a reservation, and they seated us outside right away. The well trimmed shrubs created a nice sense of privacy, while not being weird. Our server was EXCELLENT. I have seen some discussion about service in other reviews, but we had an amazing experience. Very attentive, went over everything on the menu (food & drinks) as well as made recommendations (only upon our request). She spoke openly about the Chef, his background, and how the menu reflects his tastes and creativity. Our drinks came out pretty quickly, and the food came out in phases to not crowd our table. We really enjoyed the duck pastrami, the fish pochi, as well as the green pea dip with sesame crisps. We stayed for upwards of 2.5 hours and they never once rushed us or made us feel like we had to leave. While we can recognize there is a slightly higher price tag that some other places close by, there is a special attention paid to details, both in the dishes and the drinks. Definitely recommend giving this place a try, they have come back from their restrictions and the slowdown from the Pandemic shutdown. Give it a chance, I think you could really enjoy yourself.

The Smores dessert was primarily some type of graham cracker cake with chocolate mixed in parts of it and some marshmallows.  Like all of the food, it looked good, but the taste was just never there.  Service wasn't the best- you order with the phone and they bring your food to you.  Some of it came pretty quick.  The appetizer came before our drinks.  Our dessert took 30 minutes.  My wife asked for extra cherries with her old fashioned and got 2.  She asked for more, and didn't get any.  She asked again, and got a few more about 5 minutes later.  The place is nice, the outdoor seating is great, but we just weren't impressed with the food.

It's a little novelty because you can just grab items and leave. I'm a controls engineer and pretty sure Amazon is simple recording everything in store then having a human review and tally purchases.  I doubt Amazon is doing this fully autonomously when human labor is so cheap.

Some things that are annoying:

1. Only a single small sign that tells you the one tiny button to hit in the Amazon app to display a QR code to gain entry

2. Store was about 50% empty. Most of the produce was gone and many empty shelves

3. Only name brand junk food.

4. Small selection of produce

5. Alcohol section is lacking

6. Prices are a little higher than other locations

7. Amazon doesn't give you a reciept or charge immediately. This further supports my idea that the store is simply reviewing purchases after the fact. Since there's no reciept, and I didn't record the prices for what I purchased there's no way to know if the charge will be accurate. Amazon can increase prices and there's no way to know unless you're prepared.

Basically this is a worse version of any convience store. Lack of selection, lack of prepared foods, no idea of the charges.

If you're in a hurry, go to a 7/11, CVS, gas station etc. If you are hungry go to a real grocery store.

If you want to give Bezos more money to continue to exploit employees and waste it on sub orbital flights with a poorly designed rocket, then go to Amazon Fresh

I had to rent a car a number of times these last few months and have gone to several different locations, including with other companies.  I appreciate the customer service here, especially Tyler.  On a previous rental, when I got lost, he help me navigate to their location.  I was dealing with a serious medical emergency  regarding a parent about a hour away and needed to get back my rental.  Tyler was kind to say that I can stay at the hospital and get the car back as soon as the emergency was settled. If you have ever had a number of things go wrong at once and someone makes one of those things better, it means the world.
I read some of the other reviews here, for example, when people have to wait for the reps at the desk, yes that can be frustrating. But the reps take you down the elevator to the garage and help you find your rental.  Its is a large hotel location, it can take time. They gave him the ultimate dose before telling me that this would be it!  So I had no chance to say good-bye to him or pet him!  I was really upset.

Today, 2016, I needed their cooperation to work with another vet's office to get some pain medication today for my new cat who has cancer.  I called three times in the a.m. and never got a response.  It just went to voice mail and no one ever bothered to call me back.

I'd like to say something good about this clinic, but with these experiences, I simply cannot.   They do not exhibit the sensitivity and care that I would and should expect from any veterinary clinic.

My apartment flooded and Bernstein COMPLETELY BOTCHED taking care of it. I was out of town over the weekend and got an email LATE SUNDAY that the apartments in the basement started flooding ON SATURDAY (15 hours before). I don‚Äôt know why Bernstein chose not to contact residents when the flooding started, since DC is the ultimate commuter city and most people leave the city on the weekend (not to mention it was August and people go on vacation). I rushed home to find that my apartment had been torn apart because some poor maintenance person had to move all of my stuff out of the water. I understand that sometimes flooding happens, but for the love of God you NEED TO TELL THE RESIDENTS OF YOUR BUILDING WHEN THE FLOODING STARTS. Also, in the days after the flooding Bernstein did not inform residents of when maintenance workers would be coming in, how long machinery would be in our apartments, and when they were relocating us to do renovations.

Positives: Located really close to the Potomac Avenue metro, near Harris Teeter, parking on site even though it's expensive, never had any problems with noise, I am a fan of people having to rent out the roof because prior to that policy people were sleeping and partying up there every night and it was gross

Negatives: Maintenance and office requests go unanswered, the gym equipment is sparse, if you live in the basement you will not have cell reception, the place is like living in a hotel because they do not allow residents to have wreaths on their doors, the apartments were made cheaply (I have electrical outlets that do not work, when maintenance eventually came they told me the outlets were not even hooked up to any internal wiring)

We were in the neighborhood on a weekday and decided to get some takeout from Glassey. This restaurant had been on our list for a while ever since we got to try food from this restaurant at our friends'.

The location is convenient though you have to look for the entrance next to the other businesses.

We tried the following dishes:
Chicken Biryani  - this was a good dish - rice was cooked well and the chicken was tender and flavorful.

Saag Chicken - this was a good dish and had a kick to it too. The spinach provided a nice flavor to the dish.

Butter Chicken - it was a good dish, not necessarily what you would expect for the traditional butter chicken. But it had enough flavors to be a good dish.

The accompanying channa dish with the rice was a good version that satisfy all types of palates.

Definitely a good place for Indian food and we should be back soon for more of their food!

The Khalil Gibran Memorial is one of the most obscure memorials in Washington, D.C., but one that's worth a visit if you're nearby. It's near the Observatory across the street from the U.K. Embassy and right next to the Embassy of South Africa.

The memorial itself is small, but mighty. As you cross a small stone bridge, you read about this Lebanese- American writer/poet. As you wind around the memorial, you read more quotes by him until you get to the center with benches and more quotes.

If you're a fan of Gibran, this is a must-visit. If you're in the area, it's a very peaceful and inspiring place to sit, reflect, and journal.

I had a bad experience here. I spoke to the owner specifying that I wanted medium waist length knotless braids. The person assigned to me was 45 minutes late. I let that go and stayed. My entire service took about 7 hours - and while the braids were neat, I quickly realized that they actually weren't knotless - the braider still used a thin knot of hair at the root. Not only that, the braids were so heavy and pulling that I couldn't put the braids in a bun! It was my first time getting knotless and there was no mirror to see what the braider was doing. When I used my front facing camera to look, the braider didn't like that. Should've been a red flag.

When I called the owner to discuss what happened, she said they have a policy that they do not refund at all and that she could fix it. How would she fix an entire head of braids installed wrong? Who has 7+ more hours to dedicate to this? She wouldn't even give me a partial refund. Bad business and I was hoping a place in the neighborhood was good.

I took the braids out two days after getting them done (!) and it confirmed they weren't knotless. When I told the owner this she said "this is how we do knotless." So she lied. She was in the shop the entire time my hair was braided and let it happen. Never again!

Yesterday as I was loading my car I noticed a very wet and disheveled little bird who apparently has the misfortune of being caught in a recent storm. I couldn't just leave this baby there to become food for area stray cats looking for a quick snack so I ran into my house for a small box and some paper towels so that I could vet him safely into the box; once he was secure i googled "wild bird" rescue in NW, DC which is how I'd found these kind folks. When I arrived I was promptly greeted and given a short form to complete and I asked the lady if I could check on the baby bird later and i was given a caed with the birds code which I could reference when I called back. I called a few hours later and happily leared that his breed was identified as finch and that after resting and allowing his feathers to dry he was all set and flew out rescue centers doors to join a new family of finches. All's well that ends well! Im so grateful for these small organizations and
I will be donating to them during our2018 Fall CFC campaign drive! Keep up the good deeds!

I agree with the other 1 star review pointing out the inadequacy of this facility.  Given the precedent set by other zoological parks (thinking San Diego and North Carolina), this facility is inadequate.  The pins are too small, with too little artifacts for mental stimulation and social exploration.  The accompanying outside facility is also too small.  Have these animals every run more than 15ft?  And the worst part is that their demeanor seems to reflect this state of existence.  In the end, this place left me a little heavy hearted.
